original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sgo khang du cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo bri bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sgo khang du cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo bri bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, you should draw a five-part wheel in the entryway.”

original: dge slong rnams kyi sgo khang du cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo 'drir bcug pa dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag dag lhags nas 'phags pa dag /🔽bris pa 'di ci lags zhes 'dri ba na de dag gis kho bo cag gis kyang mi shes so zhas smras pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi sgo khang du cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo 'drir bcug pa dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag dag lhags nas 'phags pa dag / bris pa 'di ci lags zhes 'dri ba na de dag gis kho bo cag gis kyang mi shes so zhas smras pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the monks drew a five-part wheel in the entryway, brahmins and householders came and asked, “Noble ones, what is this drawing?”

original: der bram ze dang khyim bdag 'ongs shing lhags pa rnams la de ston par 'gyur ba'i dge slong bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: der bram ze dang khyim bdag 'ongs shing lhags pa rnams la de ston par 'gyur ba'i dge slong bsko bar bya'o //
translated: When they said, “We don’t know,” the Blessed One said, “Monks, you should appoint a monk who can explain it to the brahmins and householders who come and go.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong bsko bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas @169a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong bsko bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas @169a *//
translated: When the Blessed One said, “You should appoint a monk,”

original: de dag bye brag med par byis pa yang rung rmongs pa yang rung mi gsal ba yang rung mi mkhas pa yang rung ba las sko bar byed nas /
analyzed: de dag bye brag med par byis pa yang rung rmongs pa yang rung mi gsal ba yang rung mi mkhas pa yang rung ba las sko bar byed nas /
translated: they appointed a monk without any distinction, whether he was a child, a fool, an unclear speaker, or an unskilled speaker.

original: de dag bdag nyid kyis kyang mi shes na bram ze dang khyim bdag 'ongs shing lhags pa rnams la ston par 'gyur ba lta ga la shes nas /
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid kyis kyang mi shes na bram ze dang khyim bdag 'ongs shing lhags pa rnams la ston par 'gyur ba lta ga la shes nas /
translated: If they do not know themselves, how can they teach it to the brahmins and householders who come and go?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: nus pa las bsko bar bya'o //🔽rgyal po'i khab na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: nus pa las bsko bar bya'o // rgyal po'i khab na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: “They should be appointed based on their abilities.”🔽In Rājagṛha there lived a certain householder. He took a wife from a family of equal status, and he enjoyed himself with her with the five kinds of sensual pleasures.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa de'i bu byung nas /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa de'i bu byung nas /
translated: He had a son.

original: des chung ma la smras pa /
analyzed: des chung ma la smras pa /
translated: He said to his wife,

original: bzang mo bdag cag gi nor 'phrog pa longs spyod 'phrog pa byung gi /
analyzed: bzang mo bdag cag gi nor 'phrog pa longs spyod 'phrog pa byung gi /
translated: “My dear, a son has been born to us who will take away our wealth and enjoyments.🔽I will take goods and go to sea.”

original: kho bo zong thogs te rgya mtsho chen por 'jug go ;rje'i sras de ltar mdzod cig /
analyzed: kho bo zong thogs te rgya mtsho chen por 'jug go ;rje'i sras de ltar mdzod cig /
translated: “Do so, my lord.”

original: de zong thogs te rgya mtsho chen por zhugs pa dang / de de nyid du tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar gyur to //
analyzed: de zong thogs te rgya mtsho chen por zhugs pa dang / de de nyid du tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar gyur to //
translated: He took goods and went to sea, and there he met with misfortune and died.

original: chung ma des khye'u de nye ngu'i stobs dang lag stobs kyis bsnyod cing gsos te bskyed nas des yi ge dang yig 'bru dag slob tu bcug nas de 'jig rten gyi gtam rgyud la shin tu mkhas par gyur to //
analyzed: chung ma des khye'u de nye ngu'i stobs dang lag stobs kyis bsnyod cing gsos te bskyed nas des yi ge dang yig 'bru dag slob tu bcug nas de 'jig rten gyi gtam rgyud la shin tu mkhas par gyur to //
translated: The boy was raised by his mother and step-father, and he was taught to read and write. He became very learned in the worldly treatises.

original: khye'u de ne'u ldangs dang lhan cig 'od ma'i tshal du song ste gtsug lag khang du zhugs pa dang / des sgo khang na cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo bris pa mthong nas des dge slong la dris @169b pa; 'phags pa bris pa 'di ci lags /
analyzed: khye'u de ne'u ldangs dang lhan cig 'od ma'i tshal du song ste gtsug lag khang du zhugs pa dang / des sgo khang na cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo bris pa mthong nas des dge slong la dris @169b pa; 'phags pa bris pa 'di ci lags /
translated: “When the boy became a young man, he went to the Bamboo Grove together with some friends. When he entered the monastery, he saw a drawing of the five-part wheel in the gateway. He asked a monk, ‘Noble one, what is this drawing?’

original: dge slong des smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong des smras pa /
translated: The monk said,

original: bzhin bzang 'di dag ni 'gro ba lnga ste /
analyzed: bzhin bzang 'di dag ni 'gro ba lnga ste /
translated: ‘Good man, these are the five destinies:

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / lha dang / mi dag go ;des yang dris pa /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / lha dang / mi dag go ;des yang dris pa /
translated: the hells, animals, hungry ghosts, gods, and humans.’ He asked further,🔽‘What are these five destinies?’

original: 'phags pa 'di dag gis las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas sems can dmyal ba dag tu skyes shing des da ltar dbyung ba dang gtub pa dang gcad pa dang gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar gyur /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'di dag gis las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas sems can dmyal ba dag tu skyes shing des da ltar dbyung ba dang gtub pa dang gcad pa dang gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar gyur /
translated: What actions did these noble ones do, that the results of those actions caused them to be born in the hells, and that they now experience the suffering of being pulled out, cut, chopped, and sawed?

original: bzhin bzang 'di dag gis mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag cher kun tu bsten cing goms par byas /
analyzed: bzhin bzang 'di dag gis mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag cher kun tu bsten cing goms par byas /
translated: “Good people, these beings greatly relied upon, became habituated to, and increased the paths of the ten nonvirtuous actions.

original: lan mang du byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes shing des da ltar dbyung ba dang gtub pa dang gcad pa dang gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan mang du byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes shing des da ltar dbyung ba dang gtub pa dang gcad pa dang gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The results of those actions caused them to be born in the hells, and they now experience the suffering of being pulled out, cut, chopped, and sawed.”

original: 'phags pa 'di dag gis kyang las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas dud 'gro rnams su skyes shing des da ltar gcig la gcig 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'di dag gis kyang las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas dud 'gro rnams su skyes shing des da ltar gcig la gcig 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
translated: “What karma did these noble ones create that matured to cause them to be born as animals, and to experience the suffering of eating one another?”

original: bzhin bzang 'di dag gis ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag ches srab pa dang ches chung ba dag kun tu bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas dud 'gro rnams su skyes shing de da ltar gcig la🔽gcig za ba'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar @170a *//
analyzed: bzhin bzang 'di dag gis ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag ches srab pa dang ches chung ba dag kun tu bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas dud 'gro rnams su skyes shing de da ltar gcig la gcig za ba'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar @170a *//
translated: “Good people, they relied upon, became habituated to, and increased the paths of the ten nonvirtuous actions, and so by the maturation of that karma they were born as animals, and now they experience the suffering of eating one another.

original: gyur to // 'phags pa 'di dag gis kyang las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas yi dvags rnams su skyes shing des da ltar bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar gyur /
analyzed: gyur to // 'phags pa 'di dag gis kyang las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas yi dvags rnams su skyes shing des da ltar bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar gyur /
translated: “What karma did these noble ones create that matured to cause them to be born as hungry ghosts, and to experience the suffering of hunger and thirst?”

original: bzhin bzang 'di dag gis ni ser sna kun tu bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas yi dvags rnams su skyes shing des da ltar bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar gyur🔽to // 'phags pa 'o na 'di dag gis las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas lha rnams su skyes shing des da ltar lha'i bde ba dag nyams su myong bar gyur /
analyzed: bzhin bzang 'di dag gis ni ser sna kun tu bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas yi dvags rnams su skyes shing des da ltar bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar gyur to // 'phags pa 'o na 'di dag gis las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas lha rnams su skyes shing des da ltar lha'i bde ba dag nyams su myong bar gyur /
translated: “Good people, it is because they have relied on, become habituated to, and increased acts of stinginess that they have been born as hungry ghosts and are now experiencing the suffering of hunger and thirst.🔽“Noble one, what actions did they perform that ripened into their birth as gods and their experience of the happiness of the gods?”

original: bzhin bzang 'di dag gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam cher kun tu bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas lha rnams su skyes shing des da ltar lha'i bde ba dag nyams su myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: bzhin bzang 'di dag gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam cher kun tu bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas lha rnams su skyes shing des da ltar lha'i bde ba dag nyams su myong bar gyur to //
translated: “Good people, it is because they have relied on, become habituated to, and increased the ten virtuous actions that they have been born as gods and are now experiencing the happiness of the gods.”

original: 'phags pa 'di dag gis las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas mi rnams su skyes shing des da ltar bde ba chung ngu nyams su myong bar gyur /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'di dag gis las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas mi rnams su skyes shing des da ltar bde ba chung ngu nyams su myong bar gyur /
translated: “What karma did these noble ones create that ripened into their birth among humans, and that they now experience a small amount of happiness?”

original: bzhin bzang 'di dag gis ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam chung ngu kun tu bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas mi rnams su skyes shing des da ltar bde ba chung ngu nyams su myong @170b bar gyur to
analyzed: bzhin bzang 'di dag gis ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam chung ngu kun tu bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas mi rnams su skyes shing des da ltar bde ba chung ngu nyams su myong @170b bar gyur to
translated: “Good people, they cultivated, made a habit, and increased the small path of the ten virtuous actions. The ripening of that karma caused them to be born among humans, and they now experience a small amount of happiness.”

original: // 'phags pa 'di la bdag 'gro ba gsum po sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags dag ni mi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: // 'phags pa 'di la bdag 'gro ba gsum po sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags dag ni mi 'tshal lo //
translated: “Noble one, I do not want the three destinies of the hell beings, animals, and pretas.

original: 'gro ba gnyis po lha dang mi gnyis ni 'tshal lo; ;'phags pa bdag gis las ci bgyis na des bdag lhar skye bar 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis po lha dang mi gnyis ni 'tshal lo; ;'phags pa bdag gis las ci bgyis na des bdag lhar skye bar 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: I want the two destinies of gods and humans. Noble one, what karma can I create so that I will be born as a god?”

original: bzhin bzang yod do //
analyzed: bzhin bzang yod do //
translated: “Good people, there is.”

original: gang lags / bzhin bzang bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan sngar rab tu byung la tshangs par spyad pa spyod cig dang / gal te tshe 'di nyid la kun shes pa rtogs par gyur na de nyid khyod kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtha' yin no //
analyzed: gang lags / bzhin bzang bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan sngar rab tu byung la tshangs par spyad pa spyod cig dang / gal te tshe 'di nyid la kun shes pa rtogs par gyur na de nyid khyod kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtha' yin no //
translated: If you realize complete knowledge in this very life, that will be the end of your suffering.

original: gal te kun tu spyod pa lhag ma dang bcas pas dus byed par gyur na khyod lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te kun tu spyod pa lhag ma dang bcas pas dus byed par gyur na khyod lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you die with residual conduct, you will be reborn among the gods.

original: 'phags pa yun ji srid du /
analyzed: 'phags pa yun ji srid du /
translated: “Noble one, for how long?

original: bzhin bzang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du'o //
translated: “Good sir, for as long as you live.

original: de ni rngo mi thog na thabs gzhan 'ga' mchis sam /
analyzed: de ni rngo mi thog na thabs gzhan 'ga' mchis sam /
translated: “Noble one, if I cannot do that, is there any other means?

original: yod do // gang lags /
analyzed: yod do // gang lags /
translated: “Yes, there is.

original: bzhin bzang bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan sngar lnga pa tshangs par spyod pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dag long zhig /
analyzed: bzhin bzang bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan sngar lnga pa tshangs par spyod pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dag long zhig /
translated: “Good sir, take the five precepts of pure conduct in the Blessed One’s presence.

original: 'phags pa yun ji srid du /
analyzed: 'phags pa yun ji srid du /
translated: “Noble one, for how long?

original: bzhin bzang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du'o //
translated: “Good sir, for as long as you live.

original: 'phags pa de yang rngo mi thog na thabs gzhan ci mchis /
analyzed: 'phags pa de yang rngo mi thog na thabs gzhan ci mchis /
translated: “Noble one, if I cannot do that, is there any other means?🔽“Yes, there is.

original: yod do // gang lags /
analyzed: yod do // gang lags /
translated: “Yes, there is.

original: bzhin bzang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol cig dang lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin bzang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol cig dang lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Good man, invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to a meal, and you will be reborn among the gods.”

original: 'phags pa kar sha pa na du tsam dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs @171a *//🔽tshod khyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags pa kar sha pa na du tsam dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs @171a *// tshod khyed par 'gyur /
translated: “Noble one, how many kārṣāpaṇas does it take to invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to a meal?”

original: bzhin bzang kar sha pa na lnga brgyas so //
analyzed: bzhin bzang kar sha pa na lnga brgyas so //
translated: “Good man, it takes five hundred kārṣāpaṇas.”

original: 'phags pa de ni rngo thog go zhes des dge slong de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te song nas rang gi khyim ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa de ni rngo thog go zhes des dge slong de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te song nas rang gi khyim ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: “Noble one, I can do that.” He bowed down at the feet of the monk and left. He went to his own house and, when he got there,

original: ma la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: ma la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: he said this to his mother:

original: yum bdag deng 'od ma'i tshal du mchis nas bdag gi de na cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo bris pa mthong ste de na 'gro ba lnga po sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags dang / lha dang mi dag bris na /
analyzed: yum bdag deng 'od ma'i tshal du mchis nas bdag gi de na cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo bris pa mthong ste de na 'gro ba lnga po sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags dang / lha dang mi dag bris na /
translated: “Mother, today I went to the Bamboo Grove and saw a wheel drawn with five sections. In it were drawn the five destinies of the beings of the hells, animals, hungry ghosts, gods, and humans.

original: yum khyod ngan bu lha rnams su skye bar bzhed dam /
analyzed: yum khyod ngan bu lha rnams su skye bar bzhed dam /
translated: “Mother, do you wish for me to be reborn as a god?”

original: bu kho mo sems can thams cad lha rnams su skye ba yang 'dod na khyod lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: bu kho mo sems can thams cad lha rnams su skye ba yang 'dod na khyod lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: “Son, if I wish for all sentient beings to be reborn as gods, what need is there to speak of you?”

original: yum khyod kyis bdag la kar sha pa na lnga brgya stsol cig dang bdag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol lo //
analyzed: yum khyod kyis bdag la kar sha pa na lnga brgya stsol cig dang bdag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol lo //
translated: “Mother, give me five hundred silver coins and I will offer a meal to the community of monks headed by the Buddha.”

original: bu khyod kyang kho mos nye du'i stobs dang lag stobs kyis bsnyod cing gsos te bskyed pa yin pas kho mo la kar sha pa na lnga brgya'i 'byor pa ga la yod /
analyzed: bu khyod kyang kho mos nye du'i stobs dang lag stobs kyis bsnyod cing gsos te bskyed pa yin pas kho mo la kar sha pa na lnga brgya'i 'byor pa ga la yod /
translated: “Son, I have nourished you with the strength of my relatives and the strength of my own hands. How can I have five hundred silver coins?”

original: yum bdag gla rngan gyi slad du las bgyid du mchi'o //
analyzed: yum bdag gla rngan gyi slad du las bgyid du mchi'o //
translated: “Mother, I will work for wages.”

original: bu khyod ni shin tu gzhon pa yin pas khyod kyis gla rngan gyi phyir las byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: bu khyod ni shin tu gzhon pa yin pas khyod kyis gla rngan gyi phyir las byed par mi nus so //
translated: “Son, you are very young. You cannot work for wages.”

original: yum rngo thog gi mchi'o //
analyzed: yum rngo thog gi mchi'o //
translated: “Mother, I will do it.”

original: des de dus kyis 'chu bar shes te gnang nas khye'u de gla mi'i srang du song ste bsdad pa dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag dag gis gla mi gzhan dag khrid na @171b de 'gas kyang ma khrid nas des der nyi ma nub par byas nas nam sros pa dang khyim du 'ongs so //
analyzed: des de dus kyis 'chu bar shes te gnang nas khye'u de gla mi'i srang du song ste bsdad pa dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag dag gis gla mi gzhan dag khrid na @171b de 'gas kyang ma khrid nas des der nyi ma nub par byas nas nam sros pa dang khyim du 'ongs so //
translated: The man knew it was time to leave, so he gave his permission. The boy went to the street of laborers and stayed there. When the brahmins and householders hired other laborers, no one hired him. He stayed there until sunset. When night fell, he returned home.

original: mas de mthong nas dris pa /
analyzed: mas de mthong nas dris pa /
translated: His mother saw him and asked,

original: bu khyod kyis ded gla rngan gyi phyir las byas sam /
analyzed: bu khyod kyis ded gla rngan gyi phyir las byas sam /
translated: “Son, did you work for wages?”

original: khye'us smras pa /
analyzed: khye'us smras pa /
translated: The boy said,

original: yum bdag sus kyang ma khrid do //
analyzed: yum bdag sus kyang ma khrid do //
translated: “Mother, no one hired me.”

original: bu gla mi dag ni 'di mi 'dra ste /🔽gla mi dag ni skra yegs shing gos dri ma can dag gyon nas gla mi'i srang du song ste sdod kyi /
analyzed: bu gla mi dag ni 'di mi 'dra ste / gla mi dag ni skra yegs shing gos dri ma can dag gyon nas gla mi'i srang du song ste sdod kyi /
translated: “Son, laborers are not like this.🔽Laborers go to the street of laborers with their hair disheveled and wearing dirty clothes.

original: khyod kyang gal te gla rngan gyi phyir las byed par 'dod na skra yegs par gyis la gos dri ma can dag gyon te gla mi'i srang du song la sdod cig /
analyzed: khyod kyang gal te gla rngan gyi phyir las byed par 'dod na skra yegs par gyis la gos dri ma can dag gyon te gla mi'i srang du song la sdod cig /
translated: If you want to work for wages, dishevel your hair, put on dirty clothes, and go to the street of laborers.”

original: des phyi de nyin par skra yegs par byas shing gos dri ma can dag gyon nas /
analyzed: des phyi de nyin par skra yegs par byas shing gos dri ma can dag gyon nas /
translated: The next day he got up late, his hair disheveled, and wearing dirty clothes.

analyzed: 'phags @174b pa dag gdan tshus gsol cig /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das tshong dpon de'i bkad sa ga la ba der gshegs te byon nas /

analyzed: drug sde dag kyang khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim dag tu khye'u tshus zos nas de nyid du dong ste 'khod do //

analyzed: de nas khyim bdag gi bu des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bde bar bzhugs par rig nas bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byed cing stobs par byed do // de de na rgyu ba na drug sde dag gus par byas te /
translated: Then, the householder’s son, knowing that the Buddha and the rest of the community of monks were seated comfortably, with his own hands satisfied them with many good, wholesome foods and served them.

original: mi za ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi za ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug ste gsol pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di na 'phags pa kha cig gus par bgyis te mi 'tshal na bdag lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar mi 'gyur lags pa snyam /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Householder’s son,

analyzed: bzhin bzang re zhig gnas mal gyi longs spyod kyis kyang khyod lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: “Good man, if you are born among the gods just by enjoying the bedding,

analyzed: kha zas kyi longs spyod kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos / de nas bcom ldan 'das khyim bdag gi bu de la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /
translated: what need is there to mention enjoying the food?”🔽Then the Blessed One, with a talk consistent with the Dharma, instructed, inspired,

analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad / yang dag par gzengs bstod par @175a *// mdzad / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: enthused, and delighted the householder’s son.

original: rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
translated: With many categories of talk consistent with the Dharma, he instructed,🔽inspired,🔽enthused, and delighted him.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: Having instructed, inspired,

analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
translated: enthused, and delighted him in many ways with talk consistent with the Dharma, he rose from his seat and departed.

original: tshong pa lnga brgya tsam rgya mtsho chen po nas rgyal po'i khab tu lhags nas rgyal po'i khab tu dus ston byung bas tshong cung zad kyang ma rnyed nas de na tshong pa dge slong gi rgyus shes pa zhig 'dug pa des smras pa /
analyzed: tshong pa lnga brgya tsam rgya mtsho chen po nas rgyal po'i khab tu lhags nas rgyal po'i khab tu dus ston byung bas tshong cung zad kyang ma rnyed nas de na tshong pa dge slong gi rgyus shes pa zhig 'dug pa des smras pa /
translated: About five hundred merchants had come to the king’s capital from the great ocean. Since a festival was being held in the king’s capital, they had not been able to get any business at all. There was a merchant there who knew a monk. He said,

original: shes ldan dag shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: shes ldan dag shes par gyis shig /
translated: “Sirs, understand this!

original: khyim gang du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gdugs tshod gsol pa'i khyim de na gor ma chags par bza' ba dang btung ba lhag pa'i chos cung zad yod kyi /
analyzed: khyim gang du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gdugs tshod gsol pa'i khyim de na gor ma chags par bza' ba dang btung ba lhag pa'i chos cung zad yod kyi /
translated: In the house where the Buddha and the community of monks are invited to eat, there is certainly some leftover food and drink.

original: der dong la rin gyis btsal lo //
analyzed: der dong la rin gyis btsal lo //
translated: Go there and buy it for a price.”

original: de dag gis smras pa dang / tshong dpon che ge mo zhig gi khyim du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis gdugs tshod gsol to zhes thos nas de dag zong thogs te der dong nas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa dang / tshong dpon che ge mo zhig gi khyim du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis gdugs tshod gsol to zhes thos nas de dag zong thogs te der dong nas smras pa /
translated: They said, “We have heard that the Buddha and the community of monks are invited to eat in the house of a certain merchant.” They took their goods and went there and said,🔽“We will buy whatever is left over from the meal of the Blessed One and the community of monks.”

original: tshong dpon bdag cag tshong pa lnga brgya tsam rgya mtsho chen po nas rgyal po'i khab tu lhags nas rgyal po'i khab tu dus ston byung bas tshong cung zad kyang ma rnyed nas bdag cag ltog par gyur na /
analyzed: tshong dpon bdag cag tshong pa lnga brgya tsam rgya mtsho chen po nas rgyal po'i khab tu lhags nas rgyal po'i khab tu dus ston byung bas tshong cung zad kyang ma rnyed nas bdag cag ltog par gyur na /
translated: “Merchant, we are five hundred merchants who have come from the great ocean to Rājagṛha. Since a festival is being held in Rājagṛha, we have not been able to do any trading at all, and so we are hungry.

original: khyod kyi khyim du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis gdugs tshod dag @175b gsol bas bza' ba dang btung ba lhag pa'i chos cung zad yod na rin gyi phyir byin cig /
analyzed: khyod kyi khyim du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis gdugs tshod dag @175b gsol bas bza' ba dang btung ba lhag pa'i chos cung zad yod na rin gyi phyir byin cig /
translated: If you have any leftover food and drink from the meal that the Buddha and the saṅgha of monks ate in your house, please sell it to us for a price.”

original: tshong dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: tshong dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: The merchant said,

original: bzhin bzang dag je lta'o zhes de khyim bdag gi bu de'i gan du song ste smras pa; bu tshong pa lnga brgya tsam rgya mtsho chen po nas rgyal po'i khab tu lhags nas rgyal po'i khab tu dus ston byung bas tshong cung zad kyang ma rnyed nas de
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag je lta'o zhes de khyim bdag gi bu de'i gan du song ste smras pa; bu tshong pa lnga brgya tsam rgya mtsho chen po nas rgyal po'i khab tu lhags nas rgyal po'i khab tu dus ston byung bas tshong cung zad kyang ma rnyed nas de
translated: “Very well.” He went to the householder’s son and said, “Son, five hundred merchants have come from the great ocean to Rājagṛha. Since a festival is being held in Rājagṛha, they have not been able to do any trading at all, and so they are hungry.

original: dag ltogs par gyur te rin gyis bza' ba dang; btung ba tshol du 'dir lhags kyi /
analyzed: dag ltogs par gyur te rin gyis bza' ba dang; btung ba tshol du 'dir lhags kyi /

analyzed: lhag pa'i chos mang du yod nas rin gyi phyir byin cig /

original: khye'us smras pa /
analyzed: khye'us smras pa /

analyzed: yab bdag rin gyi slad du mi stsol gyi /

analyzed: sbyin pa'i chos kyi slad du de bzhin du stsol gyi /
translated: I sell for the Dharma of generosity.

original: de dag mchis su stsol cig /
analyzed: de dag mchis su stsol cig /

analyzed: tshong dpon des tshong pa de dag 'dug tu bcug pa dang / khye'u des bza' ba dang btung bas de dag tshim par byas so //

analyzed: tshong pa de dag lus tshim pas ched du brjod pa 'di skad ces ched du brjod do //

analyzed: tshong dpon gang gi khyim du sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis gdugs tshod gsol cing bdag cag tshong pa lnga brgya yang bza' ba dang btung bas tshim par byas pa'i tshong dpon des ni rnyed pa dag legs par rnyed do //
translated: “The head merchant whose house the Buddha and the saṅgha of monks took their meal in, and who satisfied us five hundred merchants with food and drink, has gained a good gain!”

original: tshong dpon des smras pa /
analyzed: tshong dpon des smras pa /

translated: This is the food of this householder’s son.”

original: de dag gis dris pa /
analyzed: de dag gis dris pa /
translated: They asked,

analyzed: 'di khyim bdag gang gi bu yin /

analyzed: tshong dpon gyis smras pa /

analyzed: khyim bdag che ge mo zhig gi'o //

analyzed: ded dpon gyis khye'u la smras pa / bu long zhig /

analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag khyod la dga' bas dga' ba'i dbang du byas bar bya'o //

analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: bdag cag gis ji ltar shes par bya /

translated: They said, ‘How can we anoint this merchant’s son as our leader?’ They did this three times, and everyone else picked seeds of various colors.🔽But the merchant’s son picked only seeds of one color.

analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu des ni sa bon kha dog gcig pa sha stag zin nas de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: shes ldan dag /
translated: ‘Sirs,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag drag shul can la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the householder Aḍakavat by remaining silent.

original: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ste /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ste /
translated: Then the householder Aḍakavat, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent, took leave of the Blessed One and left.

original: des zho shas 'tsho rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: des zho shas 'tsho rnams la smras pa /
translated: He said to his servants,

original: shes ldan dag bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa yongs su bsnyel cing gshegs kyi /
analyzed: shes ldan dag bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa yongs su bsnyel cing gshegs kyi /
translated: “Sirs, the Blessed One, together with the saṅgha of monks, has been invited and will go.

original: zhal zas gtsang zhing bsod pa mang po dag sta gon gyis shig /
analyzed: zhal zas gtsang zhing bsod pa mang po dag sta gon gyis shig /
translated: Prepare a great deal of pure and fine food.”

original: de dag gis zhal zas gtsang zhing bsod pa mang po dag sta gon byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis zhal zas gtsang zhing bsod pa mang po dag sta gon byas so //
translated: They prepared a great deal of pure and fine food.

original: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can nang par sngar langs te gdan bshams nas chur bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can nang par sngar langs te gdan bshams nas chur bzhag ste /
translated: Then the householder Aḍakāvatī, having risen early in the morning, arranged seats, set out water,

original: bcom ldan 'das la spyan 'dren gyis btsun pa gdugs tshod g-yar dgongs 'tshal na bcom ldan 'das kyis da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol zhes spyan drangs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la spyan 'dren gyis btsun pa gdugs tshod g-yar dgongs 'tshal na bcom ldan 'das kyis da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol zhes spyan drangs so //
translated: and invited the Blessed One, “Noble one, please consider this the proper time. The meal is ready.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: dga' bo nye dga' khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim dag tu 'dong /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim dag tu 'dong /
translated: “Nandaka and Upanandaka, let’s go to the houses of householders.”

original: de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bya'o //
translated: “Let’s do that.”

original: de dag gis bsod snyoms pa zhig mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis bsod snyoms pa zhig mthong nas smras pa /
translated: They saw a monk who was a panhandler and said,

original: tshur shog khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim du 'dong ngo //
analyzed: tshur shog khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim du 'dong ngo //
translated: “Come, let’s go to the houses of householders.”

original: @180b zhes de khrid nas de dag ches sngar yangs pa can du zhugs nas khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim dag tu dong ba dang / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: @180b zhes de khrid nas de dag ches sngar yangs pa can du zhugs nas khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim dag tu dong ba dang / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They took him along and entered Vaiśālī earlier than usual. They went to the houses of householders, and they said,

original: 'phags pa dag zhal chus gsol cig /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag zhal chus gsol cig /
translated: “Noble ones, please drink water.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa; kho bo cag mgron du bos so //
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa; kho bo cag mgron du bos so //
translated: The group-of-six said, “We were invited.”🔽“By whom?”

original: sus / khyim bdag drag shul can gyis so //
analyzed: sus / khyim bdag drag shul can gyis so //
translated: “By the householder Aṅgulimāla.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'phags pa dag 'o na aa mra'i 'khur ba dag gsol cig /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag 'o na aa mra'i 'khur ba dag gsol cig /
translated: “Noble ones, then eat the mango preserves.”

original: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag gis aa mra'i 'khur ba dag zos so //
analyzed: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag gis aa mra'i 'khur ba dag zos so //
translated: “We will do that,” and they ate the mango preserves.

original: bsod snyoms pa de mi za nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa de mi za nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The alms-begging monk did not eat them, and they said,

original: 'phags pa khyod kyis kyang aa mra'i 'khur ba dag gsol cig /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyis kyang aa mra'i 'khur ba dag gsol cig /
translated: “Noble one, you should eat the mango preserves.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,🔽“I am a one-seater.”

original: kho bo stan gcig pa yin no; ;de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: kho bo stan gcig pa yin no; ;de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'o na snoms te bzhud la de nyid du gsol cig /
analyzed: 'o na snoms te bzhud la de nyid du gsol cig /
translated: “Then take them and eat them right there.”

original: des lhung bzed chung ngu bkang ste der song ba dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun ni zhugs so //
analyzed: des lhung bzed chung ngu bkang ste der song ba dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun ni zhugs so //
translated: He filled his small alms bowl and went there, but the saṅgha of monks had already left.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrubs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrubs so //
translated: The Blessed One was sitting on his seat, and the alms-begging monk had to make his own meal.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu lngas rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrub par mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu lngas rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrub par mdzad de /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas, for five reasons, accept material goods and accomplish alms.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: nang du yang dag 'jog par bzhed pa dang / lha rnams la chos ston par bzhed pa dang / nad pa lta bar bzhed pa dang / gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bzhed pa'o //🔽don 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar bzhed pas rdzas @181a *//
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog par bzhed pa dang / lha rnams la chos ston par bzhed pa dang / nad pa lta bar bzhed pa dang / gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bzhed pa'o // don 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar bzhed pas rdzas @181a *//
translated: To rest in inner proper composure, to teach the Dharma to the gods, to see the sick, to inspect the bedding, and to establish the bases of training for the disciples in the Vinaya.

original: las byung ba ni bzhugs shing /
analyzed: las byung ba ni bzhugs shing /
translated: In this case, the Bhagavān, wishing to establish the bases of training for the disciples in the Vinaya, accepted material goods

original: bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrub pa mdzad do //
analyzed: bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrub pa mdzad do //
translated: and accomplished alms.

original: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun bde bar 'khod par rig nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun bde bar 'khod par rig nas /
translated: Then the householder Caṇḍa, knowing that the Saṅgha of monks was seated at ease,🔽with his own hand served and satisfied them with various kinds of good food and drinks.

original: bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byed cing stobs par byed do //
analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byed cing stobs par byed do //
translated: He satisfied them with his own hands with pure, fine, and delicious food and drink.

original: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can bsod snyoms pa de'i mdun du 'dug pa dang / bsod snyoms pa des bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can bsod snyoms pa de'i mdun du 'dug pa dang / bsod snyoms pa des bsams pa /
translated: Then the householder Aḍakavat, sitting in front of the alms-beggar, thought,

original: khyim bdag la 'di ltar 'dis aa mra'i 'khur ba zos so zhes bya ba de ltar rig par gyur gyi /
analyzed: khyim bdag la 'di ltar 'dis aa mra'i 'khur ba zos so zhes bya ba de ltar rig par gyur gyi /
translated: This householder must have realized that I ate the mango dish.🔽As long as he doesn't find fault with me, I will tell him.

original: ji srid du 'dis bdag klan ka ma rnyed pa de srid du bdag gis 'di la brjod par bya'o snyam nas des khyim bdag drag shul can la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: ji srid du 'dis bdag klan ka ma rnyed pa de srid du bdag gis 'di la brjod par bya'o snyam nas des khyim bdag drag shul can la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Thinking this, he said to the householder Aḍakavat,

original: khyim bdag bdag 'ba' zhig gis aa mra'i 'khur ba dag zos par ma zad kyi drug sde 'di dag gis kyang aa mra'i 'khur ba dag zos so //
analyzed: khyim bdag bdag 'ba' zhig gis aa mra'i 'khur ba dag zos par ma zad kyi drug sde 'di dag gis kyang aa mra'i 'khur ba dag zos so //
translated: Householder, not only did I eat the mango dish, but these six also ate the mango dish.

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,🔽Noble one, I will not say anything to you.

original: 'phags pa ci'i phyir de skad ces bdag 'ba' zhig gis aa mra'i 'khur ba dag zos par ma zad kyi drug sde 'di dag gis kyang aa mra'i 'khur ba dag zos so //🔽zhes zer zhes des spyos te smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa ci'i phyir de skad ces bdag 'ba' zhig gis aa mra'i 'khur ba dag zos par ma zad kyi drug sde 'di dag gis kyang aa mra'i 'khur ba dag zos so // zhes zer zhes des spyos te smras pa /
translated: “Noble one, why do you say, ‘Not only did I eat the mango preserves, but the group of six ate the mango preserves’?”

original: 'phags pa ci kho bo la aa mra'i 'khur ba dag med snyam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa ci kho bo la aa mra'i 'khur ba dag med snyam mam /
translated: He scolded him, saying, “Noble one, do you think I have no mango preserves?”

original: des zho shas 'tsho ba dag la smras pa /
analyzed: des zho shas 'tsho ba dag la smras pa /
translated: He said to the menial workers,

original: shes ldan dag aa mra'i 'khur ba dag gis sprog ma dag phye shig /
analyzed: shes ldan dag aa mra'i 'khur ba dag gis sprog ma dag phye shig /
translated: “Sirs, open the bags of mango preserves.”

original: de dag gis phye'o //
analyzed: de dag gis phye'o //
translated: They opened them.

original: de nas dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pas bsod snyoms blangs nas bcom ldan 'das @181b ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pas bsod snyoms blangs nas bcom ldan 'das @181b ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Then the monk who had gone for alms took the alms and went to the Blessed One. When he arrived, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet, and he sat down to one side.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos nyid kyis bsod snyoms sgrub pa'i dge slong la dge slong ji ltar zas bsod dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos nyid kyis bsod snyoms sgrub pa'i dge slong la dge slong ji ltar zas bsod dam /
translated: It is the nature of the buddhas, the blessed ones, to ask the monks who have gone for alms, “Monks, was the alms successful?

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa 'dis so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa yin pas //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa 'dis so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa yin pas //
translated: Did you satisfy the community of monks? In this way, he made them happy.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pa la dge slong ji lta zas bsod dam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pa la dge slong ji lta zas bsod dam /
translated: The Blessed One asked the monk who went for alms, Monk, was the food good?

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa dang / des gsol pa; btsun pa te por zas bsod cing dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par ni bgyis na /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa dang / des gsol pa; btsun pa te por zas bsod cing dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par ni bgyis na /
translated: Did you satisfy the community of monks? He replied, Lord, the food was good and I satisfied the community of monks.

original: 'di ltar khyim bdag drag shul can gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun spyos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyim bdag drag shul can gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun spyos so //
translated: However, the householder Caṇḍa has scolded the community of monks.

original: don gang la /
analyzed: don gang la /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: des skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: des skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: He then explained the situation in detail to the Blessed One. The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong khyim bdag drag shul can gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun gnas su spyos so //
analyzed: dge slong khyim bdag drag shul can gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun gnas su spyos so //
translated: Monk, the householder Caṇḍa has scolded the community of monks in their dwelling place.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhal zas kyi bya ba mdzad nas gtsug lag khang gi slad rol tu zhabs gnyis bsil te nang du yang dag 'jog gi slad du gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhal zas kyi bya ba mdzad nas gtsug lag khang gi slad rol tu zhabs gnyis bsil te nang du yang dag 'jog gi slad du gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having finished his meal, washed his feet outside the monastery, and entered the monastery for the day’s meditation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gong du gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gong du gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having risen from his meditation, sat in front of the community of monks on the seat prepared for him.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la @182a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la @182a *//
translated: Then the Blessed One, on this occasion, with regard to this,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: gathered the community of monks, saying, “Monks, you should not eat again and again.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, knowing the right time to ask about what has arisen, the right time to say what is meaningful, the right time to be silent,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la rmas pa /
translated: the Blessed Buddha asked the monks,

original: dge slong dag khyed yang yang za ba bden nam /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed yang yang za ba bden nam /
translated: “Monks, is it true that you eat again and again?”🔽“It’s true, Blessed One.”

original: btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do //
translated: Venerable, you are right.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, criticized this, saying,🔽“This is not in accordance with the Dharma,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accordance with the monastic code,🔽it is not in accordance with good qualities,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad par mdzad do //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad par mdzad do //
translated: and it is not something that the ordained should do.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having criticized this in many ways,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: spoke to the monks:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Monks, since I see ten benefits, I establish a training rule for the monks, that those who are faithful may gain faith and those who have faith may increase in it.”

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, my śrāvakas should recite this training rule:

original: yang yang za na ltung byed do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi de ltar bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: yang yang za na ltung byed do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi de ltar bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One laid down this training rule for the monks: ‘“If a monk eats fresh or cooked food that he has accepted directly from a householder, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”🔽The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed in the Ṛṣipatana Deer Park near Vārāṇasī.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can na spre'u rdzing gi 'gram khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang bzang na bzhugs so; ;dge slong na ba zhig sman pa'i gnas su song ba dang des de mthong nas smras pa /🔽bzhin bzang kho bo la sman ston cig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can na spre'u rdzing gi 'gram khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang bzang na bzhugs so; ;dge slong na ba zhig sman pa'i gnas su song ba dang des de mthong nas smras pa / bzhin bzang kho bo la sman ston cig /
translated: At that time a certain monk was sick. He went to the doctor, and the doctor said,🔽“Noble one, prescribe some medicine for me.”

original: 'phags pa je zhal tshus gsol cig /
analyzed: 'phags pa je zhal tshus gsol cig /
translated: “Eat some salt and oil.”

original: bzhin bzang bcom ldan 'das kyis @182b ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: bzhin bzang bcom ldan 'das kyis @182b ma gnang ngo //
translated: “But, sir, the Buddha has not allowed it.”

original: 'phags pa de khyod kyi sman lags te /
analyzed: 'phags pa de khyod kyi sman lags te /
translated: “Noble one, that is your medicine.

original: gzhan du khyod kyis 'tsho bar mi spyod do //
analyzed: gzhan du khyod kyis 'tsho bar mi spyod do //
translated: Otherwise you will not be able to live.”

original: bzhin bzang bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar mdzad de //
analyzed: bzhin bzang bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar mdzad de //
translated: “But, sir, the Buddha has laid down a training rule.”

original: 'phags pa khyod kyi ston pa thugs rje can lags pas de nyid rkyen du mdzad nas gnang bar 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyi ston pa thugs rje can lags pas de nyid rkyen du mdzad nas gnang bar 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Noble one, your teacher is compassionate. He will make an exception for you.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis skabs de bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis skabs de bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na na ba'i dus ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na na ba'i dus ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, I authorize the use of a sitting mat except when one is sick.”

original: dge slong dag mchod rten gyi las dang dge 'dun gyi las dag byas pa na de dag bkres nas glos phab ste nyal zhing dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed par mi nus pa na bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gtsug lag khang du lhags nas
analyzed: dge slong dag mchod rten gyi las dang dge 'dun gyi las dag byas pa na de dag bkres nas glos phab ste nyal zhing dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed par mi nus pa na bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gtsug lag khang du lhags nas
translated: When monks were working on a stūpa or on behalf of the saṅgha, they became hungry and fell asleep on their sides, unable to continue their work on the wholesome side. When faithful brahmins and householders came to the monastery,

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: they asked,

original: 'phags pa dag bstan pa la gcig tu brtson par bgyi ba lags na /

translated: Where have you been for so long, coming and going like the moon?”

analyzed: des smras pa /

original: 'phags pa ri brags ga ge mo zhig na khyim bdag che ge mo zhig mchis pa des phyogs bzhi'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyi don du 'dug gnas bgyid du stsal nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa ri brags ga ge mo zhig na khyim bdag che ge mo zhig mchis pa des phyogs bzhi'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyi don du 'dug gnas bgyid du stsal nas /
translated: In a certain village of the Aryas, there was a certain householder who had built a monastery for the ascetics and Brahmins of the four directions.

analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //

original: nye dgas bsams pa /
analyzed: nye dgas bsams pa /

analyzed: gal te lhung bzed nag po can 'ga' zhig gis thos par gyur na de shin tu myur ba der 'gro bar 'gyur bas bdag gis khyim bdag 'di smad na lhung bzed nag po can 'ga' la yang brjod par mi 'gyur ro snyam nas des khyim bdag la smras pa / khyod kyi snying lam na kho bo cag zan sus sbyin par 'gyur /
translated: If any of the black-bowl people hear about this, they will go there very quickly. So if I criticize this householder, I will not be speaking about any of the black-bowl people. He said to the householder,

analyzed: gos sus sbyin par 'gyur snyam pa las gzhan pa bsam gtan nam klog pa 'ga' yang mi sems snyam mam /

analyzed: khyim bdag des bsams pa /

analyzed: de dag gis bdag rgya cher smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas /

original: de cang mi smra bar 'dug go /
analyzed: de cang mi smra bar 'dug go /

analyzed: nye dgas kyang khyim bdag de smad nas drug sde dag gi @188b gan du song ste smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gis yun ji srid kyis phongs pa spang bar bya /

analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: khyod kyis thos pa cung zhig yod dam /

analyzed: yod de ri brags ga ge mo zhig na khyim bdag che ge mo zhig 'dug pa des phyogs bzhi'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyi don du 'dug gnas byed du bcug nas /
translated: “Yes, there is a householder in a certain village who has built a monastery for the śramaṇas and brahmans of the four directions.

analyzed: de nas gang dag 'dug pa de dag la chos gos dang bsod snyoms kyis mkho ba stobs par byed kyi /

original: der 'dong ngo //
analyzed: der 'dong ngo //

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /

original: ci thams cad 'dong ngam /
analyzed: ci thams cad 'dong ngam /

original: nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas smras pa /

original: mi drug kho na 'dong ngo //
analyzed: mi drug kho na 'dong ngo //

analyzed: de ltar bya'o zhes drug po de dag ri brags ga la ba der rgyu zhing dong ngo //

original: gcer bu pa de dag gis kyang smras pa /
analyzed: gcer bu pa de dag gis kyang smras pa /

analyzed: shes pa can dag spyod yul rjes su 'jug par byas 'dong ngo //

analyzed: drug sde dag kyang mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'dong pa na ri brags der phyin nas de dag khyim bdag de'i gan du dong ste smras pa /

analyzed: khyim bdag aa rog gya aa rog gya /

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /

analyzed: khyed cag su yin /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag go /
translated: “The Blessed One’s śrāvakas.”

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /

analyzed: ma nongs te bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos dag mthong bar 'tshal na khyed cag kyang byon no //

translated: “Noble ones, I have had a dwelling built for the sake of the ascetics and brahmins of the four directions. Please stay there,

original: gis khyed cag la bsod snyoms kyis mkho ba bstab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gis khyed cag la bsod snyoms kyis mkho ba bstab par bgyi'o //
translated: and I will provide you with the requisites of almsfood.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

analyzed: gnas mal khri'am khri'u cung zad yod dam /

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: ma mchis so //
analyzed: ma mchis so //
translated: No, Blessed One.🔽🔽

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

analyzed: khyim bdag kho bo cag sa la mal 'cha' bar mi byed do //
translated: “Householder, we do not make our beds on the ground.”

original: gcer bu pa des smras pa /
analyzed: gcer bu pa des smras pa /
translated: The naked ascetic said,🔽“Householder,

analyzed: kye sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong dag 'di khyed kyi gtsug lag khang yang ma yin la 'dug gnas kyang ma yin na khyed cag 'dir gar 'jug /

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group-of-six said,

original: kva'e shes pa can ci zer /
analyzed: kva'e shes pa can ci zer /
translated: “Hey, you know-nothing, what are you saying?

analyzed: 'di kho bo cag gi gtsug lag khang yang ma yin la 'dug gnas kyang ma yin no //
translated: This is not our monastery, nor is it our dwelling place.”

original: zhes ma zer cig /
analyzed: zhes ma zer cig /
translated: “Don’t say that!

analyzed: gal te 'dug na ni 'dug tu zad /

original: gcer bu pa des bsams pa /
analyzed: gcer bu pa des bsams pa /
translated: The naked ascetic thought,

original: 'di dag ni mi drug yod la /
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi drug yod la /
translated: “There are six of them,

analyzed: bdag ni gcig pu yin pas bdag gis 'di dag la ci yang bya bar mi nus pas 'di dag gis bdag la gnod pa byas par gyur na mi rung ngo //
translated: and I am alone. I can’t do anything to them, so it wouldn’t be right for them to harm me.”🔽Thinking this, he ran away in fear.

analyzed: snyam nas de skrag ste bros so; ;drug sde dag nyi ma re re zhing khyim bdag de'i khyim du dong ste za bar byed do //
translated: The group-of-six went to the householder’s house every day to eat.

analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na khyim bdag de la ri brags gzhan zhig tu bya ba cung zhig byung nas des drug sde @189b dag la smras pa /

original: de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bya'o //

original: khyim bdag des nang mi la smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag des nang mi la smras pa /

analyzed: khyod kyis 'phags pa dag la ji ltar bsnyen bkur byas pa de bzhin du kho bo phyir 'ongs kyi bar du yang gyis shig /
translated: “Until I return, you should serve the noble ones as you have been doing.”

analyzed: de ri brags der song ba dang drug sde dag nyi ma re re zhing der dong ste de bzhin du za bar byed pa na de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis 'khod par bya /
translated: “ Nanda and Upananda, how long will we have to live by the conduct of others?

original: rang gi spyod lam bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi spyod lam bstan par bya'o //
translated: We should show our own conduct.”

original: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “ We will do that,” they said.🔽“ Nanda and Upananda, look at the beauty of this woman’s eyes, ears, teeth, lips, breasts, waist, thighs, and feet.

original: dga' bo nye dga' bud med 'di'i mig dag dang rna ba dag dang so dag dang mchu dag dang nu ma dag dang rked pa dag dang brla dag dang rkang pa dag mdzes pa la ltos shig /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bud med 'di'i mig dag dang rna ba dag dang so dag dang mchu dag dang nu ma dag dang rked pa dag dang brla dag dang rkang pa dag mdzes pa la ltos shig /

analyzed: ltos shig / bud med de ngo tsha nas gnas khang du zhugs te 'dug go /

analyzed: khyim bdag de yang ri brags de nas 'ongs nas des nang mi la dris pa /
translated: The householder returned from the mountain village and asked his family,🔽“Did you serve the worthy recipients who came?”

original: khyod kyis sbyin gnas dag byon nas de bzhin du gsol tam /🔽des smras pa /
analyzed: khyod kyis sbyin gnas dag byon nas de bzhin du gsol tam / des smras pa /

analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i sbyin gnas dag ni 'ga' yang ma mchis kyang mi dngo'o //

translated: I have heard from your guests, the naked ascetics, the musicians, and the young boys, words that I have never heard before.

original: khyim @190a *// bdag des bsams pa /
analyzed: khyim @190a *// bdag des bsams pa /
translated: The householder thought,

original: bud med kyi yul dag ni skyes pa la sems pa yin pas gcer bu ba sgren mo dag zhugs pa de dag mthong ba na chags par 'gyur gyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos sham thabs legs par bgos pa /
analyzed: bud med kyi yul dag ni skyes pa la sems pa yin pas gcer bu ba sgren mo dag zhugs pa de dag mthong ba na chags par 'gyur gyi / bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos sham thabs legs par bgos pa /
translated: “Women are attracted to men. When they see the naked ascetics, they will be attracted to them.

original: chos gos legs par bgos pa de dag la 'di mi dga'o snyam nas /
analyzed: chos gos legs par bgos pa de dag la 'di mi dga'o snyam nas /
translated: But they are not attracted to the Blessed One’s disciples, who wear their lower garments and Dharma robes well.🔽”

original: des de la smras pa /
analyzed: des de la smras pa /
translated: He said to his wife,

analyzed: khyod gcer bu pa sgren mo dag la dga'i / bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos sham thabs legs par bgos pa /
translated: “You are attracted to the naked ascetics,

analyzed: chos gos legs par bgos pa dag la khyod dga' bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: but how could you be attracted to the Blessed One’s disciples, who wear their lower garments and Dharma robes well?”🔽His wife said,

original: chung mas smras pa /
analyzed: chung mas smras pa /
translated: His wife said,🔽🔽“What is the use of that?”

original: rje'i sras gal te khyod bdag la thugs mi ches na bdag gis khyod kyi mngon sum du 'gyur bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: rje'i sras gal te khyod bdag la thugs mi ches na bdag gis khyod kyi mngon sum du 'gyur bar bgyi'o //
translated: “Lord, if you don’t believe me, I’ll make it clear to you.”

original: khyim bdag gis bsams pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis bsams pa /
translated: The householder thought,

analyzed: je bgam par bya'o snyam nas de nyi ma nyung shas shig 'dug nas drug sde dag la smras pa /

analyzed: 'phags pa dag yang bdag la ri brags der bgyi ba cung zhig byung ste bdag der mchi yi /
translated: “Noble ones, I have a little business in that village.

original: khyed cag bdag gi sdum pa na ji ltar gsol ba de bzhin du bdag slar mchis kyi bar du gsol cig /
analyzed: khyed cag bdag gi sdum pa na ji ltar gsol ba de bzhin du bdag slar mchis kyi bar du gsol cig /
translated: I’ll go there, and you should eat in my house as you have been doing until I return.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bya'o //
translated: “We will do that.”

analyzed: khyim bdag de yang gnas khang du zhugs te 'dug pa dang / drug sde dag kyang de bzhin du de'i khyim du zhugs te 'khod nas /
translated: The householder went to his house and sat down, and the group of six entered the house and sat down as they had been doing.

original: de dag la de'i chung ma des brim par brtsams pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag la de'i chung ma des brim par brtsams pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder’s wife began to serve them, and the group of six said,🔽“We don’t eat what’s been served by a woman.

original: dga' bo nye dga' bud med 'di'i mig dag dang rna ba dag dang so dag @190b dang mchu dag dang nu ma dag dang rked pa dag dang brla dag dang rkang pa dag mdzes pa la ltos shig /🔽ltos shig / khyim bdag des de thos nas bsams pa /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bud med 'di'i mig dag dang rna ba dag dang so dag @190b dang mchu dag dang nu ma dag dang rked pa dag dang brla dag dang rkang pa dag mdzes pa la ltos shig / ltos shig / khyim bdag des de thos nas bsams pa /
translated: Look at them!”

analyzed: bdag gis 'phral kho na la 'di dag gi bsod snyoms bcad pa ni bdag gis tshul dang mthun pa ma yin gyi /
translated: When the householder heard that, he thought, “It’s not right for me to stop their alms right away.

original: thabs kyi rnam pa zhig bya'o snyam nas /🔽des de'i nyin mo 'khur ba gcig phri ba dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: thabs kyi rnam pa zhig bya'o snyam nas / des de'i nyin mo 'khur ba gcig phri ba dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' spyod yul tshig go zhes de dag gis smras pa /
translated: So he reduced the amount of food by one load a day, and the group of six said, “Nanda and Upananda, the alms are running out.”

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gis mu to ba dag la 'khur pa gcig sbyin par bya ba de deng phyin chad sbyin du med do //
translated: They said, “Venerables, we can’t give the bakers one load of food anymore.”

original: de phyi de nyin par 'khur ba gnyis pa phri ba dang de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de phyi de nyin par 'khur ba gnyis pa phri ba dang de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The next day he reduced it by two loads, and they said,

original: dga' bo nye dga' spyod yul tshig go zhes de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' spyod yul tshig go zhes de dag gis smras pa /
translated: Nanda, Upananda, this is not the right place to talk.”

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gis 'khur ba gzhan gcig lhung bzed kyi 'og gzhir dor ba de yang deng phyin chad dor du med do //

analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bla na med pa de'i tshe de nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do // tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
translated: and you will understand: ‘My births have been exhausted.🔽I have practiced pure conduct.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what needed to be done.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so @193b zhes go bar byed cing dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so @193b zhes go bar byed cing dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /

analyzed: bong ba dang gser du mnyam pa /
translated: equal toward a clod of earth and gold,🔽with a mind like space and the palm of his hand,🔽his mind liberated like a piece of sandalwood placed on a stand.

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa; tsan dan bzhag pa lta bur rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur pa rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa srid pa dang 'dod pa'i rnyed pa
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa; tsan dan bzhag pa lta bur rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur pa rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa srid pa dang 'dod pa'i rnyed pa
translated: He had attained knowledge, higher knowledge, and discriminative understanding. He had turned his back on existence, desire, gain,🔽and honor. He was worshipped by Indra, Upendra, and the gods,

original: dang bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / brjed par bya ba dang / mngon du smra bar bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: dang bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / brjed par bya ba dang / mngon du smra bar bya bar gyur to //
translated: and was revered and praised.

original: de nas 'khor de tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di lta bu'i rgol ba tshar bcad do zhes ya mtshan skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas 'khor de tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di lta bu'i rgol ba tshar bcad do zhes ya mtshan skyes par gyur to //
translated: Then the assembly was amazed to see how Venerable Śāriputra had defeated the challenger.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'khor de'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal dang khams dang rang bzhin shes nas 'di ltar srog chags 'bum phrag du ma dag gis bden pa dag mthong zhing kha cig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'khor de'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal dang khams dang rang bzhin shes nas 'di ltar srog chags 'bum phrag du ma dag gis bden pa dag mthong zhing kha cig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the assembly, taught the Dharma in such a way that many hundreds of thousands of living beings saw the truths. Some actualized the fruit of stream entry,

original: du byas / kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: du byas / kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
translated: some actualized the fruit of once-returning,

original: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
translated: some actualized the fruit of non-returning,

original: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas pa de ltar chos bstan par byas te 'khor de las phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol pa dang chos la 'bab pa dang dge 'dun la bab
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas pa de ltar chos bstan par byas te 'khor de las phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol pa dang chos la 'bab pa dang dge 'dun la bab
translated: and some went forth and actualized the fruit of arhatship by abandoning all defilements. Having taught the Dharma in this way, he established the majority of the assembly in devotion to the Buddha, in devotion to the Dharma, and in devotion to the Saṅgha,

original: par rnam @194a *//🔽par bzhag go /
analyzed: par rnam @194a *//🔽par bzhag go /
translated: and in the realization of the fruits.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'jig rten rgyang phan pa 'char ka snga dro tshar bcad nas phyi dro drug sde dag mnyan yod du lhags nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'jig rten rgyang phan pa 'char ka snga dro tshar bcad nas phyi dro drug sde dag mnyan yod du lhags nas /
translated: The venerable Śāriputra defeated the Lokāyata Pūraṇa Kāśyapa in the morning, and in the evening the group of six arrived in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa /

original: khyed cag ga la 'ongs /
analyzed: khyed cag ga la 'ongs /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus lho lam nas 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i rgol ba bram ze kun tu rgyu 'char ka zhes bya ba 'gyed 'dod cing 'gyed pa'i yo byad kyi phyir 'ongs pa tshar bcad de g-yul las rnam par rgyal lo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus lho lam nas 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i rgol ba bram ze kun tu rgyu 'char ka zhes bya ba 'gyed 'dod cing 'gyed pa'i yo byad kyi phyir 'ongs pa tshar bcad de g-yul las rnam par rgyal lo //
translated: The venerable Śāriputra has defeated the brahmin wandering ascetic named Pūraṇa Kāśyapa, who came from the southern region desiring to debate, for the sake of debate. He has won the battle.

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: Venerable ones,

analyzed: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu tshogs can gnyis pa chos kyi dmag dpon chos kyi 'khor lo rjes su bskor bas rgol ba gcig tshar bcad pa 'di ngo mtshar ci che /
translated: it is no wonder that the venerable Śāriputra, the second in the assembly, the general of the Dharma, has defeated a single opponent by turning the wheel of the Dharma.

original: gal te tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshar bcad par ma gyur na yang bcom ldan 'das slad na bzhugs pas de ngo mtshar mi che'o //
analyzed: gal te tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshar bcad par ma gyur na yang bcom ldan 'das slad na bzhugs pas de ngo mtshar mi che'o //
translated: If the Venerable Śāriputra had not defeated them, it would not have been a great wonder if the Blessed One had been present.

original: kho bo cag mi drug gis gcer bu pa drug cu tshar bcad pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag mi drug gis gcer bu pa drug cu tshar bcad pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: It is a great wonder that we six defeated sixty naked ascetics.

original: rig pa'i gnas gang la dbyug pa'i rig pas lus la chos bshad pas so //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas gang la dbyug pa'i rig pas lus la chos bshad pas so //
translated: In which field of knowledge? In the knowledge of the stick, by explaining the Dharma to the body.

original: ci 'tsho'am 'on te shi /
analyzed: ci 'tsho'am 'on te shi /
translated: Are they alive or dead?

original: de'i tshe na ni 'tsho na da tsam 'tsho'am shi gtol med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe na ni 'tsho na da tsam 'tsho'am shi gtol med do //
translated: At that time, they were alive. Now, we do not know whether they are alive or dead.🔽Some monks with few duties criticized: Why do the monks boast with the very limbs that should be ashamed?

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag yan lag gang gis ngo tsha bar bya ba'i yan lag de nyid kyis rlom par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag yan lag gang gis ngo tsha bar bya ba'i yan lag de nyid kyis rlom par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: They ridiculed,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and gossiped.

analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan @194b 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu bar mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu bar mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then the Blessed One, on this occasion, with this connection, and with this incident, assembled the saṅgha of monks, as was said before.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are aware of what is going on, but ask anyway. As was said before,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag la rmas pa /

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis mi mdzes pa de lta bu de byas par gyur ba bden nam /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis mi mdzes pa de lta bu de byas par gyur ba bden nam /
translated: “Monks, is it true that you did such and such an unbecoming thing?”

original: btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Yes, Reverend Sir.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha rebuked them,🔽“Monks, this is not fitting for one gone forth,🔽it is not allowable,

analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad par mdzad do //
translated: it is not proper,🔽it is not worthy of a monastic. ”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /🔽dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa / dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having censured him in many ways, said to the monks:

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, for these ten benefits I have seen, the basis of training for my disciples in the Monastic Law should be laid down thus:
