analyzed: 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pa'i dge slong gis bsod snyoms gcig bza' bar bya'o //
translated: ‘An ordained disciple of the Buddha who has stayed one night in a monastery should eat one alms-round meal.

original: de las lhag par za na ltung byed do //
analyzed: de las lhag par za na ltung byed do //
translated: If he eats more than that, he commits an offense.’”

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi de ltar bca' bar mdzad do //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan @195a *//
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi de ltar bca' bar mdzad do // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan @195a *//
translated: Thus the Blessed One laid down this basis of training in the Monastic Law for my disciples.

original: yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de nas khyim bdag de zong thogs te ri brags de nyid du phyin nas de khyim bdag de'i tshong khang du zhugs pa dang / khyim bdag gis gcer bu pa dag la brims par brtsams nas des khyim bdag de'i gan du mi mngags te grogs po sbyin gnas dag la brim par byas tshur shog ces sbran pa dang /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag de zong thogs te ri brags de nyid du phyin nas de khyim bdag de'i tshong khang du zhugs pa dang / khyim bdag gis gcer bu pa dag la brims par brtsams nas des khyim bdag de'i gan du mi mngags te grogs po sbyin gnas dag la brim par byas tshur shog ces sbran pa dang /
translated: Then the householder went to that hill town with his goods. He entered the householder’s shop, and the householder began to distribute the food to the naked ascetics. He sent a man to the householder, saying, “Friend, distribute the food to the worthy recipients. Come here.”

original: khyim bdag de dad pa can yin pas des bsams pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag de dad pa can yin pas des bsams pa /
translated: The householder was faithful, so he thought,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag yin gor ma chag gi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag yin gor ma chag gi /
translated: “They must be the Blessed One’s hearers.

original: song la blta'o snyam nas de der song ba dang / ji tsam na gcer bu pa ngo tsha dang khrel bor ba dag cig yin par mthong nas /
analyzed: song la blta'o snyam nas de der song ba dang / ji tsam na gcer bu pa ngo tsha dang khrel bor ba dag cig yin par mthong nas /
translated: I will go and see.” He went there, and when he saw that they were naked ascetics who had abandoned shame and conscience,

original: mngon sum du mi snyan pa brjod pa ni sdug bsngal ba yin pas de cang mi smra bar 'dug go /
analyzed: mngon sum du mi snyan pa brjod pa ni sdug bsngal ba yin pas de cang mi smra bar 'dug go /
translated: he thought, “It is painful to say unpleasant things to their faces,” so he remained silent.

original: de dag zos te dong ba dang khyim bdag gis de la smras pa /
analyzed: de dag zos te dong ba dang khyim bdag gis de la smras pa /
translated: When they had eaten and left, the householder said to him,🔽“Friend, was the field good? Were the seeds good?”

original: grogs po zhing bzang zhing sa bon bzang ngam /
analyzed: grogs po zhing bzang zhing sa bon bzang ngam /
translated: Are your friends good? Are your fields good? Are your seeds good?🔽

original: khyim bdag des smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag des smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: grogs po sa bon ni bzang na zhing ni gcer bu pa ngo tsha dang khrel bor ba'i sdig pa'i lta ba can dgon dung tshva sgo can tha chad sdig pa can gyi sa gzhi sha stag yin no //
analyzed: grogs po sa bon ni bzang na zhing ni gcer bu pa ngo tsha dang khrel bor ba'i sdig pa'i lta ba can dgon dung tshva sgo can tha chad sdig pa can gyi sa gzhi sha stag yin no //
translated: “Friend, the seeds are good, but the fields are the naked ascetics, who are shameless, sinful, and have wrong views. The fields are the land of the wicked and sinful.

original: khyim bdag des smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag des smras pa /
translated: ” The householder said,

original: grogs po zhing ches bzang ba gzhan yod dam /
analyzed: grogs po zhing ches bzang ba gzhan yod dam /
translated: “Friend, are there any other fields that are better?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: yod de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag go /
analyzed: yod de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag go /
translated: “There are, the disciples of the Blessed One.”

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: grogs po de dag gi ming yang ma smros shig /
analyzed: grogs po de dag gi ming yang ma smros shig /
translated: “Friend, don’t even mention their names!”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: ci de dag 'dir lhags par gyur tam /
analyzed: ci de dag 'dir lhags par gyur tam /
translated: “Have they come here?”

original: lhags so // @195b gang dag drug sde dag go /
analyzed: lhags so // @195b gang dag drug sde dag go /
translated: “They have. They are the group of six.”

original: de dag gis re zhig ci byas /
analyzed: de dag gis re zhig ci byas /
translated: “What have they done?”

original: 'di dang 'di lta'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta'o //
translated: “This and that.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: grogs po khyod kyis rgya mtsho chen po nas nor bu mching bu dag blangs so //
analyzed: grogs po khyod kyis rgya mtsho chen po nas nor bu mching bu dag blangs so //
translated: “Friend, you have brought back glass beads from the great ocean!”

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa; bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos bzang po gzhan dag kyang yod dam /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa; bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos bzang po gzhan dag kyang yod dam /
translated: The householder said, Are there any other good disciples of the Blessed One?

original: yod de gal te khyod kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po dang / nam gru dang / ma 'gags pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos chen po gzhan dag mthong bar gyur na khyod mngon par dad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gnas yod do //
analyzed: yod de gal te khyod kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po dang / nam gru dang / ma 'gags pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos chen po gzhan dag mthong bar gyur na khyod mngon par dad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gnas yod do //
translated: There are. If you were to see the other great disciples of the Blessed One, such as the venerable Śāriputra, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Revata, Aniruddha, and so on, you would develop faith.

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: gal te de dag 'dir byon par gyur na bdag gis de dag la bsod snyoms kyis mkho ba bstab par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de dag 'dir byon par gyur na bdag gis de dag la bsod snyoms kyis mkho ba bstab par bya'o //
translated: If they were to come here, I would offer them the necessities, such as alms.

original: khyim bdag des bsams pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag des bsams pa /
translated: The householder thought,

original: da ni bdag song la bcom ldan 'das la gsol bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: da ni bdag song la bcom ldan 'das la gsol bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: Now I will go and request the Blessed One.

original: khyim bdag des zong bsgyur te rin blangs nas mnyan yod ga la ba der song ste mthar gyis mnyan yod du phyin to //
analyzed: khyim bdag des zong bsgyur te rin blangs nas mnyan yod ga la ba der song ste mthar gyis mnyan yod du phyin to //
translated: The householder sold his goods, took the price, went to Śrāvastī, and eventually arrived in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas khyim bdag des zong tshong khang du sbas nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des zong tshong khang du sbas nas /
translated: Then the householder hid the goods in a shop,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: went to the Blessed One, and upon his arrival, bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet, and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la khyim bdag des 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la khyim bdag des 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: After he had sat to one side, the householder said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: btsun pa ri brags ga ge mo zhig na khyim bdag che ge mo zhig mchis pa des phyogs bzhi'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyi slad du 'dug @196a *//
translated: “Lord, a certain householder in a certain village has made a dwelling for the śramaṇas and brahmins of the four directions.

original: gnas bgyid du stsal te de de na gang gnas pa de la bsod snyoms kyis mkho ba stobs par bgyid cing /
analyzed: gnas bgyid du stsal te de de na gang gnas pa de la bsod snyoms kyis mkho ba stobs par bgyid cing /
translated: He provides the necessities to those who live there.

original: de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag mthong bar 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la thugs brtse ba'i slad du der dge slong dag cig bka' stsal na legs so //
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag mthong bar 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la thugs brtse ba'i slad du der dge slong dag cig bka' stsal na legs so //
translated: Since he wishes to see the Blessed One’s śrāvakas, it would be good if the Blessed One would order some monks to go there out of compassion for him.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the householder by remaining silent.

original: de nas khyim bdag des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas /
translated: Then the householder, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and left the Blessed One’s presence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gang gis khyim bdag de 'khor dang bcas pa dang / ri brags de na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dag 'dul bar 'gyur snyam du dgongs na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gang gis khyim bdag de 'khor dang bcas pa dang / ri brags de na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dag 'dul bar 'gyur snyam du dgongs na /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought, “Which monk will be able to tame that householder and his retinue and the assembly of people living in that hill town?”

original: dge slong sh'a ri'i bus 'dul bar gzigs nas /
analyzed: dge slong sh'a ri'i bus 'dul bar gzigs nas /
translated: He saw that the monk Śāriputra would be able to tame them.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: sh'a ri'i bu khyod kyis ri brags ga ge mo zhig na khyim bdag che ge mo 'khor dang bcas pa dang / ri brags na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs la soms shig /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu khyod kyis ri brags ga ge mo zhig na khyim bdag che ge mo 'khor dang bcas pa dang / ri brags na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs la soms shig /
translated: “Śāriputra, think of a certain householder and his retinue in a certain hill town and the assembly of people living in that hill town.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra🔽said, “Respected One, I will do as the Blessed One has instructed.” He then left with five hundred attendants to travel through the countryside to that village.

original: btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes bcom ldan 'das las mnyan nas 'khor lnga brgya dang ri brags de ga la ba der logs su ljongs rgyu zhing song nas mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'gro ba na ri brags der @196b phyin nas khyim bdag de'i 'dug gnas su zhugs so
analyzed: btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes bcom ldan 'das las mnyan nas 'khor lnga brgya dang ri brags de ga la ba der logs su ljongs rgyu zhing song nas mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'gro ba na ri brags der @196b phyin nas khyim bdag de'i 'dug gnas su zhugs so
translated: As they traveled through the countryside, they eventually arrived at that village and entered the house of the householder.

original: // khyim bdag des btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu 'khor lnga brgya dang ri brags 'dir 'ongs te bdag gi 'dug gnas su zhugs so zhes thos so //
analyzed: // khyim bdag des btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu 'khor lnga brgya dang ri brags 'dir 'ongs te bdag gi 'dug gnas su zhugs so zhes thos so //
translated: The householder heard that the Venerable Śāriputra had arrived in the village with five hundred attendants and had entered his house.

original: thos nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ga la ba der song ste phyin nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: thos nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ga la ba der song ste phyin nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Having heard this, he went to where the Venerable Śāriputra was. Upon arrival, he bowed his head at the feet of the Venerable Śāriputra and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyim bdag de la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par ston par byed /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyim bdag de la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par ston par byed /
translated: Then, sitting to one side, the venerable Śāriputra taught the householder the Dharma with its benefits,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jud par byed /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod par byed /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jud par byed / yang dag par gzengs bstod par byed /
translated: encouraged,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed do //🔽rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed do // rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: aroused, and delighted him.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi smra'o //🔽de nas khyim bdag de stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi smra'o // de nas khyim bdag de stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas /
translated: Having taught him the Dharma with its benefits, having encouraged, aroused, and delighted him with numerous discourses, he remained silent.🔽Then the householder rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ga la ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ga la ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: and, placing his right knee on the ground,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: he said to the venerable Śāriputra:🔽“May the Venerable Śāriputra accept my invitation to a meal tomorrow, together with the saṅgha of monks.”

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bus sang bdag gi sdum par dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bus sang bdag gi sdum par dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, please accept an invitation to take your meal tomorrow together with the saṅgha of monks in my house.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyim bdag de la cang mi smra bas dang du blangs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyim bdag de la cang mi smra bas dang du blangs so //
translated: The venerable Śāriputra assented to the householder by his silence.🔽Then the householder,

original: de nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus cang mi smra bas dang du blangs par @197a *//
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus cang mi smra bas dang du blangs par @197a *//
translated: understanding that the venerable Śāriputra had assented by his silence,

original: rig nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: rig nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: bowed his head at the venerable Śāriputra’s feet,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i drung nas song ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i drung nas song ngo //
translated: and took leave of the venerable Śāriputra.

original: de nas khyim bdag des de nyid kyi mtshan mo bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pa sta gon byas nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des de nyid kyi mtshan mo bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pa sta gon byas nas /
translated: Then the householder prepared a pure and fine meal and refreshments that night.

original: nang par sngar langs te stan bshams nas chu ra bzhag ste /
analyzed: nang par sngar langs te stan bshams nas chu ra bzhag ste /
translated: In the morning, he got up early, prepared seats, and set out water for washing.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la /
translated: He then said to the venerable Śāriputra,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, the meal is ready.

original: mngag pas btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu gdugs tshod g-yar dgongs 'tshal na bcun pa sh'a ri'i bus da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol zhes bskul lo //
analyzed: mngag pas btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu gdugs tshod g-yar dgongs 'tshal na bcun pa sh'a ri'i bus da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol zhes bskul lo //
translated: “Noble Śāriputra, please remember the time for the midday meal.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu snga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu snga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, in the morning, put on his lower and upper robes,

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te dge slong gi tshogs kyis yongs su skor cing dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi mdun du bdar nas /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te dge slong gi tshogs kyis yongs su skor cing dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi mdun du bdar nas /
translated: took his alms bowl, and surrounded by a group of monks, with the community of monks in front,

original: khyim bdag de'i khyim ga la ba der song ste phyin nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gong du stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go /
analyzed: khyim bdag de'i khyim ga la ba der song ste phyin nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gong du stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go /
translated: went to the house of that householder. Having arrived, he sat on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.

original: de nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bde bar 'dug par rig nas bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byed cing stobs par byed do //
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bde bar 'dug par rig nas bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byed cing stobs par byed do //
translated: Then the householder, knowing that the venerable Śāriputra and the community of monks were seated at ease, with his own hands satisfied them with pure, fresh food and drink, and served them.

original: rnam grangs du mar bca' ba dang / bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byas shing bstabs te /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar bca' ba dang / bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byas shing bstabs te /
translated: He satisfied him with his own hand with pure, nice food and drink of various kinds.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zan zos zhing lag pa bsnyal lhung bzed bzhag par rig nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zan zos zhing lag pa bsnyal lhung bzed bzhag par rig nas /
translated: When the venerable Śāriputra had eaten, washed his hands and bowl, and put his robe in order,

original: stan ches @197b dma' ba zhig blangs te tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i mdun du chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug go /
analyzed: stan ches @197b dma' ba zhig blangs te tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i mdun du chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug go /
translated: he took a low seat and sat before the venerable Śāriputra to listen to the Dharma.

original: 'dug nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: 'dug nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When he was seated, the householder said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu chos bstan du gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu chos bstan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, please teach the Dharma.”

original: khyim bdag de'i phyir khyod kyis sa phyogs go skabs yangs par stan 'ding du chug la /
analyzed: khyim bdag de'i phyir khyod kyis sa phyogs go skabs yangs par stan 'ding du chug la /
translated: “Householder, for that reason you should have a large area cleared and have seats prepared

original: ri brags 'dir skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu chos ston par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ri brags 'dir skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu chos ston par 'gyur gyi /
translated: for a great gathering of people in this mountain town, because tomorrow the noble Śāriputra will teach the Dharma.”

original: khyed cag las gang chos nyan par 'dod pa de shog cig ces dril bsgrag pa byed du chug cig /
analyzed: khyed cag las gang chos nyan par 'dod pa de shog cig ces dril bsgrag pa byed du chug cig /
translated: Let him proclaim with the bell: Whoever of you wishes to listen to the Dharma, let him come!

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus yon bshad pa byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus yon bshad pa byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: The Venerable Sariputra, having given the benediction, rose from his seat and departed.

original: khyim bdag de ri brags de na gtso bor grags pa yin pas des sa phyogs go skabs yangs par stan shom du bcug nas ri brags der skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu chos ston par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: khyim bdag de ri brags de na gtso bor grags pa yin pas des sa phyogs go skabs yangs par stan shom du bcug nas ri brags der skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu chos ston par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since that householder was the most famous person in that mountain village, he had a spacious place prepared, and he had the following proclamation made in the village: Tomorrow the Noble Sariputra will teach the Dharma.

original: khyed cag las gang chos nyan par 'dod pa de shog cig /
analyzed: khyed cag las gang chos nyan par 'dod pa de shog cig /
translated: Whoever of you wishes to listen to the Dharma, let him come!

original: khyed cag las gang gis der bden pa dag mthong bar ma gyur pa des 'khor bar yun ring du 'khor par bya dgos so zhes dril bsgrag pa byed du bcug go /
analyzed: khyed cag las gang gis der bden pa dag mthong bar ma gyur pa des 'khor bar yun ring du 'khor par bya dgos so zhes dril bsgrag pa byed du bcug go /
translated: And whoever of you does not see the Truths there, he will have to wander in cyclic existence for a long time.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu phyogs der song ste dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gong du stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug pa dang / srog chags 'bum phrag du ma dag kyang kha cig ni ltad mo skyes pa na /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu phyogs der song ste dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gong du stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug pa dang / srog chags 'bum phrag du ma dag kyang kha cig ni ltad mo skyes pa na /
translated: while many hundreds of thousands of living beings sat down, some out of curiosity,

original: kha cig ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis bskul ba na 'dug par gyur nas /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'khor de'i bsam pa dang bag @198a *//
analyzed: kha cig ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis bskul ba na 'dug par gyur nas / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'khor de'i bsam pa dang bag @198a *//
translated: and some out of the urging of their own past roots of virtue.

original: la nyal dang khams dang rang bzhin shes nas 'di ltar khyim bdag de 'khor dang bcas pa dang / srog chags khri nyis stong gis bden pa dag mthong zhing /🔽kha cig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: la nyal dang khams dang rang bzhin shes nas 'di ltar khyim bdag de 'khor dang bcas pa dang / srog chags khri nyis stong gis bden pa dag mthong zhing / kha cig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of that assembly, taught the Dharma accordingly. Thus, that householder and his retinue, and twelve thousand living beings, saw the truths.🔽Some manifested the fruit of stream entry.🔽Some manifested the fruit of once-returning.

original: kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /🔽kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /🔽kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
translated: Some manifested the fruit of nonreturning.

original: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas /
translated: Some went forth and, by ridding themselves of all defilements, manifested arhatship.

original: kha cig gis nyan thos kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /
analyzed: kha cig gis nyan thos kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /
translated: Some generated the intention to achieve the enlightenment of a śrāvaka.

original: kha cig gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /
translated: Some generated the intention to achieve the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha.🔽Some generated the intention to achieve unsurpassed, complete, and perfect awakening.

original: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ltar chos bstan pa byas te 'khor de las phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang chos la 'bab pa dang dge 'dun la bab par rnam par bzhag go
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ltar chos bstan pa byas te 'khor de las phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang chos la 'bab pa dang dge 'dun la bab par rnam par bzhag go
translated: In this way, having taught the Dharma, he established the majority of the assembly in devotion to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus ha cang yun ring du chos bstan pas gdugs tshod yol zhing rlung gis de'i rgyab na bar gyur nas /
analyzed: / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus ha cang yun ring du chos bstan pas gdugs tshod yol zhing rlung gis de'i rgyab na bar gyur nas /
translated: Since the venerable Śāriputra taught the Dharma for too long, it was past noon and a wind arose behind him.

original: khyim bdag des smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag des smras pa /
translated: The householder said,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, the time has passed for the meal.

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bus de'i slad du bdag gi 'dug gnas su bzhugs shig dang bdag gis khyod la bsod snyoms kyis mkho ba bstab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bus de'i slad du bdag gi 'dug gnas su bzhugs shig dang bdag gis khyod la bsod snyoms kyis mkho ba bstab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, please stay in my house. I will provide you with the requisites of almsfood.”

original: khyim bdag khyod nyid la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba @198b mdzad kyi 'gro'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag khyod nyid la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba @198b mdzad kyi 'gro'o //
translated: “Householder, the Blessed One has established a rule in the monastic code that we should not stay in the same place as you.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu na bzhin du zan bcad de ri brags de nas mnyan yod ga la ba der logs su rgyu zhing song ste mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'gro ba na mnyan yod du phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu na bzhin du zan bcad de ri brags de nas mnyan yod ga la ba der logs su rgyu zhing song ste mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'gro ba na mnyan yod du phyin nas /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, sick and fasting, left the village and went to Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dag la dris pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dag la dris pa /
translated: The monks asked the venerable Śāriputra’s pupils and attendants,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ji lta bde bar brgyus sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ji lta bde bar brgyus sam /
translated: “Venerables, did you travel comfortably?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag cung zhig bde bar yang brgyus /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag cung zhig bde bar yang brgyus /
translated: “Venerables, we traveled comfortably for a while,

original: cung zhig sdug bsngal bar yang brgyus so //
analyzed: cung zhig sdug bsngal bar yang brgyus so //
translated: and a little bit of suffering.

original: ci zhig bde bar brgyus /
analyzed: ci zhig bde bar brgyus /
translated: “What was pleasant?”

original: mkhan pos gdul bar bya ba 'di snyed cig mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni bde bar brgyus pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhan pos gdul bar bya ba 'di snyed cig mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni bde bar brgyus pa yin no //
translated: “The fact that the preceptor had to discipline so many disciples was pleasant.”

original: ci zhig sdug bsngal bar brgyus /
analyzed: ci zhig sdug bsngal bar brgyus /
translated: “What was suffering?”🔽“The fact that the preceptor, while sick, had to skip the midday meal and leave the monastery was suffering.”🔽The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: mkhan pos snyung bzhin du gdugs tshod bcad de ri brags de nas bzhud pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal bar brgyus pa yin no zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mkhan pos snyung bzhin du gdugs tshod bcad de ri brags de nas bzhud pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal bar brgyus pa yin no zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na na ba ma gtogs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na na ba ma gtogs te /
translated: “Therefore, except in the case of illness,

original: dge slong gis pus khyud bcang bar rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gis pus khyud bcang bar rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: I authorize monks to carry a staff.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang bslab pa la gus pa dang bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang bslab pa la gus pa dang bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and austerity with respect to training,

original: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang de'i shas che ba dang de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /

translated: The group-of-six taught the Dharma to them, and they said,

analyzed: snyoms gsol zhig /

original: bzhin bzang dag lto gang bas chog go /
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag lto gang bas chog go /

original: rje'i sras de ni chung ma gsod pa lags pas de la gzhan sus kyang bu mo stsol bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rje'i sras de ni chung ma gsod pa lags pas de la gzhan sus kyang bu mo stsol bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Sir, he is a man who kills his wife, so no one else will give him their daughter.

original: bzhud cig dang / sdod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhud cig dang / sdod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Go and he will stay.

original: khyim bdag de de'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag de de'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: The householder went to him and said,

original: bu bdag cag gis kha zas dag sta gon byas par gyur pa gang yin pa de sbyin gnas dag gis bzhes kyi /
analyzed: bu bdag cag gis kha zas dag sta gon byas par gyur pa gang yin pa de sbyin gnas dag gis bzhes kyi /
translated: Son, the worthy recipients have accepted the food we prepared.

original: de nye du dag gi phyir /
analyzed: de nye du dag gi phyir /
translated: For their sake,

original: kha zas sta gon byed kyi bar du nyi ma nyung shas shig sdod cig /
analyzed: kha zas sta gon byed kyi bar du nyi ma nyung shas shig sdod cig /
translated: “Stay a few days until the wedding feast is prepared.”

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: kho bo mi sdod /
analyzed: kho bo mi sdod /
translated: “I will not stay.

original: gal te nyi ma de nyid la bag mar rdzong zhing sbyin na bag mar blang ngo //
analyzed: gal te nyi ma de nyid la bag mar rdzong zhing sbyin na bag mar blang ngo //
translated: If you give your daughter to me in marriage on this very day, I will take her as my wife.

original: gal te mi sbyin na kho bo chung ma gzhan len gyi /
analyzed: gal te mi sbyin na kho bo chung ma gzhan len gyi /
translated: If you do not give her to me, I will take another wife.

original: khyod kyi bu mo dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi bu mo dor bar bya'o //
translated: I will abandon your daughter.”

original: khyim bdag de chung ma'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag de chung ma'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: The householder went to his wife and said,

original: bzang mo khyo ga de na re /
analyzed: bzang mo khyo ga de na re /
translated: “My dear, that man says,

original: gal te nyi ma de @204b nyid la bag ma rdzong zhing sbyin na bag ma blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nyi ma de @204b nyid la bag ma rdzong zhing sbyin na bag ma blang bar bya'o //
translated: ‘If you give your daughter to me in marriage on this very day, I will take her as my wife.

original: gal te ma sbyin na /
analyzed: gal te ma sbyin na /
translated: If you do not give her to me,

original: kho bo chung ma gzhan len gyi /
analyzed: kho bo chung ma gzhan len gyi /
translated: I will take another wife.

original: khyod kyi bu mo dor bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyod kyi bu mo dor bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: I will abandon your daughter.’

original: chung mas smras pa /
analyzed: chung mas smras pa /
translated: ” His wife said,

original: rje'i sras de chung ma gsod pa lags pas gzhan su zhig gis de la bu mo stsol bar 'gyur zhes des bag rdzongs sta gon bya bar brtsams so //
analyzed: rje'i sras de chung ma gsod pa lags pas gzhan su zhig gis de la bu mo stsol bar 'gyur zhes des bag rdzongs sta gon bya bar brtsams so //
translated: “My lord, he is a wife-killer. What other man would give his daughter to him?” So she prepared the wedding feast.

original: khyo ga des kyang grogs po'i sring mo yugs sa mo blangs so //
analyzed: khyo ga des kyang grogs po'i sring mo yugs sa mo blangs so //
translated: The man took the widow, the sister of his friend.

original: g-yas zhar ma'i ma des kyang kha zas sta gon byas nas yang khyim bdag de la smras pa /
analyzed: g-yas zhar ma'i ma des kyang kha zas sta gon byas nas yang khyim bdag de la smras pa /
translated: The mother of the one-sided hunchback prepared food and again said to the householder,

original: rje'i sras da khyo ga de'i gan du bzhud la bag ma len du shog cig ces gsungs shig /
analyzed: rje'i sras da khyo ga de'i gan du bzhud la bag ma len du shog cig ces gsungs shig /
translated: “Sir, now go to that man and tell him to come and take the bride.”

original: khyim bdag de de'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag de de'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: The householder went to him and said,

original: bu da bag ma len du shog cig /
analyzed: bu da bag ma len du shog cig /
translated: “Son, now come and take the bride.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: khyed kyis nyi ma de las yol bar byas pas da kho bo mi len to //
analyzed: khyed kyis nyi ma de las yol bar byas pas da kho bo mi len to //
translated: “Since you have passed the day, I will not take her.”

original: khyim bdag des khyo ga de bzung ste rgyal po'i pho brang du 'o dod bos nas shags la bkug pa dang / khyo ga des khyim bdag de pham par byas so //
analyzed: khyim bdag des khyo ga de bzung ste rgyal po'i pho brang du 'o dod bos nas shags la bkug pa dang / khyo ga des khyim bdag de pham par byas so //
translated: The householder seized the man and called out loudly in the king’s palace. He was brought before the king to settle the dispute, and the man defeated the householder.🔽The mother of the one-sided hunchback was crying, “My daughter is not married!”

original: g-yas zhar ma'i ma des bdag gi bu mo ma lom mo zhes ngu zhing 'dug pa dang / de'i ngos kyi sdum mtshes dag /
analyzed: g-yas zhar ma'i ma des bdag gi bu mo ma lom mo zhes ngu zhing 'dug pa dang / de'i ngos kyi sdum mtshes dag /
translated: The neighbors on both sides said to her,🔽“Why are you crying?”

original: sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams kyi dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go /
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams kyi dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go /
translated: “The religious practice of the śramaṇas, sons of the Śākyas, is finished.

original: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste 'di ltar bu mo byin zin pa'i bar chad byed do zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste 'di ltar bu mo byin zin pa'i bar chad byed do zhes smod par byed /
translated: The practice of the brahmins is finished, since they are creating obstacles for the marriage of a girl.”🔽They criticized,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and disparaged them.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs @205a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs @205a *//
translated: Then the Blessed One, on this occasion, for this reason,

original: 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: and at this time, assembled the saṅgha of monks and said to the monks, “Monks, it is true that you did such and such, is that not so?”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, knowing, asked,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag la rmas pa /
translated: and the Blessed One asked the group of six monks,

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis mi mdzes pa de lta bu byas par gyur pa bden nam /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis mi mdzes pa de lta bu byas par gyur pa bden nam /
translated: “Monks, is it true that you did such and such an unbecoming thing?”🔽“It is true, Blessed One.”

original: btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Venerable Sir, you are right.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, criticized this, saying,🔽“This is not in accordance with the holy life.🔽This is not allowable.

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: This is not suitable.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: This is not to be done by a monastic.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having rebuked him in many ways, taught the Dharma:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste /
translated: “Monks, I see many benefits in establishing a training rule for my disciples, the monks, to recite.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: And so on as in the previous verse.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples, the monks, should recite this training rule like this:

original: dge slong rab tu mang po dag khyim rnams su dong ba las gal te de dag la bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis phye dag dang 'khur ba dag dus kyis stobs par gyur la 'dod na dge slong de dag gis lhung bzed gang ba
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po dag khyim rnams su dong ba las gal te de dag la bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis phye dag dang 'khur ba dag dus kyis stobs par gyur la 'dod na dge slong de dag gis lhung bzed gang ba
translated: If many monks go to the houses of the faithful and the faithful brahmins and householders offer them flour and cakes, then if they wish, the monks may take as much as they need.

original: gnyis sam gsum blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis sam gsum blang bar bya'o //
translated: A number of monks went to the houses of the faithful brahmins and householders. If the faithful brahmins and householders offered them flour and cakes at the proper time, if they wished, those monks should take two or three full alms-bowls.

original: de las lhag par len na ltung @205b byed do //
analyzed: de las lhag par len na ltung @205b byed do //
translated: If they take more than that, they commit an offense.

original: lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blangs nas phyi rol kun dga' ra bar dong la dge slong 'khod pa rnams la'ang bgo bsha' bya /
analyzed: lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blangs nas phyi rol kun dga' ra bar dong la dge slong 'khod pa rnams la'ang bgo bsha' bya /
translated: Having taken two or three full alms-bowls, they should go to the outer courtyard and share them with the assembled monks.

original: bdag cag kyang bza' bar bya ste de la de ni cho ga yin no //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang bza' bar bya ste de la de ni cho ga yin no //
translated: They should also eat some themselves. That is the proper conduct.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Monks” means

original: drug sde dag go /🔽rab tu mang po dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: drug sde dag go / rab tu mang po dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: the group of six.🔽“A number of” means

original: gnyis las lhag pa ni rab tu mang po dag go /
analyzed: gnyis las lhag pa ni rab tu mang po dag go /
translated: more than two.

original: khyim rnams su zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag dag gis khyim rnams su'o //
analyzed: khyim rnams su zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag dag gis khyim rnams su'o //
translated: “The houses of the faithful brahmins and householders” means the houses of the faithful brahmins and householders.

original: dong ba las zhes bya ba ni song ba las so //
analyzed: dong ba las zhes bya ba ni song ba las so //
translated: “From the pit” means from the place where they had been.

original: gal te de dag la zhes bya ba ni dge slong de dag la'o //🔽bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis zhes bya ba la dad pa can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de dag la zhes bya ba ni dge slong de dag la'o // bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis zhes bya ba la dad pa can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If they” refers to those monks.

original: sangs rgyas la mngon par dad pa dang / chos dang dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa dang / sangs rgyas la skyabs su song ba dang / chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su song ba dag go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mngon par dad pa dang / chos dang dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa dang / sangs rgyas la skyabs su song ba dang / chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su song ba dag go /
translated: “The faithful brahmins and householders” means those who have faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, and have gone for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: phye dag ces bya ba ni phye dang 'de gu dag go /
analyzed: phye dag ces bya ba ni phye dang 'de gu dag go /
translated: “Flour” means flour and porridge.

original: 'khur ba dag ces bya ba ni bag tshos dag go /
analyzed: 'khur ba dag ces bya ba ni bag tshos dag go /
translated: “Cakes” means pastries.

original: dus kyis stobs par gyur la zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du stobs par gyur la'o //
analyzed: dus kyis stobs par gyur la zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du stobs par gyur la'o //
translated: “They would give them in a timely way” means they would give them again and again.

original: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer na'o //
analyzed: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer na'o //
translated: “If they wanted” means if they sought them.

original: dge slong de dag gis zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa dag gis so //
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa dag gis so //
translated: “Those monks” means those who were monks.

original: lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la lhung bzed ni gsum ste chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la lhung bzed ni gsum ste chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'o //
translated: There are three kinds of begging bowls: large, medium, and small.

original: de la chen po ni gang du 'bras thug po che ma ga dha'i bre'u chung do btsos pa /
analyzed: de la chen po ni gang du 'bras thug po che ma ga dha'i bre'u chung do btsos pa /
translated: The large one is the one in which one measures one Magadha doli of uncooked rice,

original: sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang @206a *//
analyzed: sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang @206a *//
translated: together with a suitable amount of vegetables and salt,

original: bcas pa blugs na kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto gang gis mi reg pa'o //
analyzed: bcas pa blugs na kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto gang gis mi reg pa'o //
translated: and when it is cooked, the edge of the mouth of the bowl is just covered, but not a single grain of rice protrudes.🔽The small one is the one in which one measures half a Magadha doli of uncooked rice,

original: chung ngu ni gang du 'bras thug po che ma ga dha'i bre chung gang btsos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto gang gis mi reg pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu ni gang du 'bras thug po che ma ga dha'i bre chung gang btsos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto gang gis mi reg pa'o //
translated: together with a suitable amount of vegetables and salt, and when it is cooked, the edge of the mouth of the bowl is just covered, but not a single grain of rice protrudes.

original: 'bring po de gnyis kyi bar ro //
analyzed: 'bring po de gnyis kyi bar ro //
translated: The medium one is between the two.

original: de las lhag par len na zhes bya ba ni de las mang du'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par len na zhes bya ba ni de las mang du'o //
translated: If one takes more than that, it is more than that.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshong bar byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshong bar byed /
translated: “Offense” means that one will be burned in the hells, as an animal, or in the realm of the hungry ghosts, in the lower realms, in bad places.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Sell” means to sell oneself.🔽“Offense” means to fall.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, as long as that offense is not confessed and not openly admitted, it is an obscuration to wholesome dharmas.

original: lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blangs nas phyi rol kun dga' ra bar dong la dge slong 'khod pa rnams la yang bgo bsha' bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blangs nas phyi rol kun dga' ra bar dong la dge slong 'khod pa rnams la yang bgo bsha' bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having taken two or three full begging-bowls, one should go to the outer courtyard and share with the resident monks.”

original: khyim gyi phyi rol gtsug lag khang du dong la de na dge slong gang dag 'khod pa rnams la yang sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim gyi phyi rol gtsug lag khang du dong la de na dge slong gang dag 'khod pa rnams la yang sbyin par bya'o //
translated: “Outer courtyard” means having gone to the monastery outside the house, one should give to the monks who are there.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense here?

original: dge slong gis lhung bzed chen po gsum len par byed na de len pa la nyes byas su 'gyur la za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis lhung bzed chen po gsum len par byed na de len pa la nyes byas su 'gyur la za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk takes on three large alms-bowls, he commits an offense of wrong conduct in taking them on, and an offense entailing confession in using them.

original: dge slong gis lhung bzed chen po gnyis dang 'bring gcig len par byed na de len pa la nyes byas su 'gyur la za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis lhung bzed chen po gnyis dang 'bring gcig len par byed na de len pa la nyes byas su 'gyur la za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk takes on two large alms-bowls and one medium-sized alms-bowl, he commits an offense of wrong conduct in taking them on, and an offense entailing confession in using them.

original: dge slong gis lhung bzed chen po gnyis dang @206b chung ngu gcig len par byed na /
analyzed: dge slong gis lhung bzed chen po gnyis dang @206b chung ngu gcig len par byed na /
translated: If a monk takes on two large alms-bowls and one small alms-bowl,

original: de len pa la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: de len pa la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: he commits an offense of wrong conduct in taking them on,

original: za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: and an offense entailing confession in using them.

original: dge slong gis lhung bzed 'bring gnyis dang chen po gcig len par byed na /
analyzed: dge slong gis lhung bzed 'bring gnyis dang chen po gcig len par byed na /
translated: If a monk takes on two medium-sized alms-bowls and one large alms-bowl,

original: de len pa la nyes byas su 'gyur la za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de len pa la nyes byas su 'gyur la za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: he commits an offense of wrong conduct in taking them on, and an offense entailing confession in using them.

original: dge slong gis ji tsam du bre'u chung phyed dang lnga las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms len na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis ji tsam du bre'u chung phyed dang lnga las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms len na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk takes on alms-food in a container that is more than half an āmalaka fruit, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: sbyin bdag gis ci bder byas pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis ci bder byas pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the benefactor does it.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is insane, deranged, or in pain.🔽The thirty-third training rule is finished.

original: lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed de sum cu gsum pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed de sum cu gsum pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The chapter on miscellaneous rules

original: bar sdom la /
analyzed: bar sdom la /
translated: The summary:

original: stan gcig dang ni chu bzhin spong //
analyzed: stan gcig dang ni chu bzhin spong //
translated: One seat, and like water,🔽Soiled, with food, and suitable,🔽“Stop,” leftovers, and soup,

original: 'bags dang zas yod rung ba dang // thong zhig lhag por thug pa dang / skyo ma'i sde tshan bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: 'bags dang zas yod rung ba dang // thong zhig lhag por thug pa dang / skyo ma'i sde tshan bsdus pa yin //
translated: The chapter is summarized in these groups.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed at Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: btsun pa mad do //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /

analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /

analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /

analyzed: 'phags pa dag zhal tshus gsol cig /

original: sus sbyin par 'gyur /
analyzed: sus sbyin par 'gyur /

analyzed: bdag gis gsol lo //

analyzed: ci dge 'dun thams cad dam /

analyzed: zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: de lta bas na na ba'i dus ma gtogs so //

analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gtsug lag khang du lhags nas /

translated: “Each person will give to five.”

analyzed: gang gi tshe bden pa dag mthong ba de'i tshe /

translated: The king said,

analyzed: des dge slong rnams la smras pa /
translated: He said to the monks,

analyzed: bdag gis kyang dge slong rnams kyi gdugs tshod bgyi'o //

analyzed: ci dge 'dun thams cad kyi byed dam /

analyzed: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis len pa po la zas sbyin pa ni gnas lnga sbyin par byed de /
translated: When donors and benefactors give food to recipients, they give five things:

original: tshe sbyin pa dang / kha dog sbyin pa dang / stobs sbyin pa dang / bde ba sbyin pa dang / spobs pa sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: tshe sbyin pa dang / kha dog sbyin pa dang / stobs sbyin pa dang / bde ba sbyin pa dang / spobs pa sbyin pa ni /
translated: They give life, they give complexion, they give strength, they give happiness, and they give eloquence.

original: bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal pa ni legs par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal pa ni legs par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: ‘They will be happy’ is well said.

original: zos na stobs dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zos na stobs dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you eat, you will become strong.

original: mi zos na mi 'gyur ro //🔽khyod @222b kyis zos sam /
analyzed: mi zos na mi 'gyur ro // khyod @222b kyis zos sam /
translated: If you don’t eat it, it will go bad.🔽“Did you eat it?”

original: zos so // khyed dus ma yin par bzar rung ngam /
analyzed: zos so // khyed dus ma yin par bzar rung ngam /
translated: “Is it permissible for you to eat it out of season?”

original: gal te dus su ma rnyed na kho bo cag gis ltogs te 'chi bar bya'am ci /
analyzed: gal te dus su ma rnyed na kho bo cag gis ltogs te 'chi bar bya'am ci /
translated: “If we don’t get it in season, will we die of hunger?”🔽“Why do monks eat fresh and cooked food out of season?”

original: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dus ma yin par bca' ba dang bza' ba za bar byed ces smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dus ma yin par bca' ba dang bza' ba za bar byed ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized and complained and spread it about.🔽The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having given a teaching on what is right and proper, addressed the monks:🔽“Monks, I rescind the rule that one should not eat fresh and cooked food out of season.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The Blessed Buddha, the Teacher, the One Who Knows, the One Who Sees, the Worthy One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the One with Wisdom and Action, the Sugata, the Knower of the World, the Leader of Men to Be Tamed, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, knowing and seeing,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong bcu bdun sde dag la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong bcu bdun sde dag la rmas pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, asked the group of seventeen monks:🔽“Monks, is it true that you eat food at the wrong time?”

original: dge slong dag khyed dus ma yin par bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha' zhing za ba bden nam /🔽btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed dus ma yin par bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha' zhing za ba bden nam / btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Yes, it is true, Venerable One.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa rjes mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa rjes mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked them, saying:🔽“Monks, how can those who are called monks eat food at the wrong time?

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: This is not in accordance with the Dharma, not in accordance with the Vinaya,🔽and not in accordance with the Teacher’s instruction.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: It is not to be done.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then, after rebuking them in many ways, the Buddha addressed the monks:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos @223a *//
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos @223a *//
translated: “Monks, I see ten benefits in laying down a training rule for the monks dwelling at Sāketa and in the vicinity of Sāketa.🔽The training rule should be laid down for the monks in Sāketa and in the vicinity of Sāketa.

original: rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: And so on as before.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “My śrāvakas should recite this training rule:

original: yang dge slong gang dus ma yin par bca' ba'am bza' ba 'cha'am za na ltung byed do //🔽yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun sde'am /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dus ma yin par bca' ba'am bza' ba 'cha'am za na ltung byed do // yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun sde'am /
translated: ‘If a monk eats fresh or cooked food at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”🔽As for “a monk,” it refers to a monk in the group of seventeen,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: or to any other monk.

original: dus ma yin par zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dus ma yin par zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin pa gnyis te /
translated: As for “at the wrong time,” there are two wrong times:

original: skya rengs ma shar ba dang / phyed yol bar ro //
analyzed: skya rengs ma shar ba dang / phyed yol bar ro //
translated: before noon and after noon.

original: bca' ba'am bza' ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bca' ba'am bza' ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “fresh or cooked food,”

original: bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga po dag go /🔽'cha'am za na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga po dag go / 'cha'am za na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: there are five kinds of fresh food and five kinds of cooked food.🔽As for “eats,”

original: mgul du mid na'o //
analyzed: mgul du mid na'o //
translated: it means to swallow.🔽“Offense entailing confession”:🔽hell, animal realm,

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshod par byed /
translated: ghost realm, lower realms, bad destinations, and falling

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is that which causes a fall.🔽

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, as long as that downfall is not confessed and disclosed, it obscures virtuous dharmas.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a downfall.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: dge slong gis dus ma yin pa la dus ma yin par 'du shes pas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong gis dus ma yin pa la yid @223b gnyis za bas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong gis dus su dus ma yin par 'du shes pas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dus ma yin pa la dus ma yin par 'du shes pas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro // dge slong gis dus ma yin pa la yid @223b gnyis za bas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro // dge slong gis dus su dus ma yin par 'du shes pas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk, perceiving the time as not being the time, eats or consumes food that is not leftover, he commits an offense of wrongdoing.🔽If a fully ordained monk, perceiving the time as being the time, eats or consumes food that is leftover, he commits an offense of wrongdoing.🔽If a fully ordained monk, perceiving the time as not being the time, eats or consumes food that is leftover, he commits an offense of wrongdoing.

original: dge slong gis dus su yid gnyis za bas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dus su yid gnyis za bas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk, perceiving the time as being the time, eats or consumes food that is not leftover, he commits an offense of wrongdoing.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the person is a beginner, or is insane, or is the first offender, or is in pain.

original: dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu bdun pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu bdun pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The thirty-seventh downfall is finished.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //🔽tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i kun tu spyod pa ni grong ngam grong rdal gang na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so // tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i kun tu spyod pa ni grong ngam grong rdal gang na /
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Jetavana, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park near Śrāvastī,

original: nye bar rten cing gnas pa na /
analyzed: nye bar rten cing gnas pa na /
translated: when the venerable Kāla was living in dependence on a certain village or town.

original: de snga dro sham thabs bgos lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
analyzed: de snga dro sham thabs bgos lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
translated: In the morning he put on his lower and upper robes, took his alms bowl,

original: grong ngam grong rdal de nyid du lus shin tu bsrungs pa dang / dbang po rnams kyis shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag pas bsod snyoms la 'jug cing gal te 'bras chan gsher pa rnyed na ni /
analyzed: grong ngam grong rdal de nyid du lus shin tu bsrungs pa dang / dbang po rnams kyis shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag pas bsod snyoms la 'jug cing gal te 'bras chan gsher pa rnyed na ni /
translated: and entered the village or town to collect alms. He was very careful to protect his body, very careful to control his senses, and very careful to maintain mindfulness. If he found some soft rice,

original: lhung bzed kyis len par byed /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyis len par byed /
translated: he would take it in his alms bowl.

original: gal te 'bras chan skam po rnyed na ni lhung bzed kyi snod kyis len par byed de /
analyzed: gal te 'bras chan skam po rnyed na ni lhung bzed kyi snod kyis len par byed de /
translated: If he finds dry rice, he puts it in his begging bowl.

original: de grong ngam grong rdal der bsod snyoms la brgyus nas gtsug lag khang du song ste /
analyzed: de grong ngam grong rdal der bsod snyoms la brgyus nas gtsug lag khang du song ste /
translated: After he has gone for alms in that village or town, he returns to the monastery.

original: 'bras chan gsher ba ni za bar byed /
analyzed: 'bras chan gsher ba ni za bar byed /
translated: He eats the moist rice.

original: 'bras @224a *// chan skam po ni bskams nas rdza ma so btang ba bkang ste 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: 'bras @224a *// chan skam po ni bskams nas rdza ma so btang ba bkang ste 'jog par byed cing /
translated: He dries the dry rice and stores it in a baked clay pot.

original: de rlung ldang ba'am yul ngan 'byung ba'am char pa 'bab pa'am /
analyzed: de rlung ldang ba'am yul ngan 'byung ba'am char pa 'bab pa'am /
translated: When a wind arises, when a storm arises, when it rains,

original: lhags pa 'byung ba gang dag byung bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: lhags pa 'byung ba gang dag byung bar gyur pa na /
translated: when a cold wind arises,

original: rlung langs pa'am yul ngan byung ba'am char pa bab pa'am /
analyzed: rlung langs pa'am yul ngan byung ba'am char pa bab pa'am /
translated: when a wind arises, when a storm arises, when it rains,🔽when a cold wind arises, he soaks the dry rice in warm water and eats it.

original: lhags pa byung ba de lta bu'i tshe 'bras chan skam po chu dron mos sbangs te zos nas bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba dag nyams su myong bar byed de //
analyzed: lhags pa byung ba de lta bu'i tshe 'bras chan skam po chu dron mos sbangs te zos nas bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba dag nyams su myong bar byed de //
translated: He experiences the bliss of meditative stabilization, liberation, and concentration.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'tsho zhing bzhugs la gson zhing gzhes pa rnams kyi chos nyid ni gdul bar gyur pa'i skye bo la rjes su thugs brtse bas dus dang dus su sems can dmyal ba rgyur gshegs pa dang / dud 'gro rgyu ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'tsho zhing bzhugs la gson zhing gzhes pa rnams kyi chos nyid ni gdul bar gyur pa'i skye bo la rjes su thugs brtse bas dus dang dus su sems can dmyal ba rgyur gshegs pa dang / dud 'gro rgyu ba dang /
translated: The nature of the blessed buddhas who are alive, live, and remain is that out of compassion for those who are to be trained, they go from time to time to the hells, to the animal realm,

original: yi dvags rgyu ba dang / lha rgyu ba dang / ljongs rgyu ba dang / chu klung rgyu ba dang / ri rgyu ba dang / dur khrod rgyu ba dang / gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs pas don 'dir ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs par bzhed nas /
analyzed: yi dvags rgyu ba dang / lha rgyu ba dang / ljongs rgyu ba dang / chu klung rgyu ba dang / ri rgyu ba dang / dur khrod rgyu ba dang / gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs pas don 'dir ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs par bzhed nas /
translated: to the realm of the hungry ghosts, to the gods, to the countryside, to the rivers, to the mountains, to the charnel grounds, and to the monasteries. In this case, the Blessed Buddha intended to go to the monastery.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo song la dge slong rnams la dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs kyi /
analyzed: kun dga' bo song la dge slong rnams la dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs kyi /
translated: “Ānanda, go and tell the monks, ‘Monks, the Tathāgata is going to the monastery.

original: khyed cag las gang de bzhin gshegs pa dang thabs cig tu gtsug lag khang @224b rgyur 'gro bar spro ba des chos gos dag long zhig ces gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed cag las gang de bzhin gshegs pa dang thabs cig tu gtsug lag khang @224b rgyur 'gro bar spro ba des chos gos dag long zhig ces gyis shig /
translated: “Whoever among you wishes to go to the monastery with the Tathāgata should take their robes.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos /
translated: The venerable Ānanda said,

original: btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes bcom ldan 'das las mnyan nas dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs kyi /
analyzed: btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes bcom ldan 'das las mnyan nas dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs kyi /
translated: “Respected One, I will do as you have instructed.” He then said to the monks, “Venerables, the Blessed One is going to the monastery.

original: khyed cag las gang de bzhin gshegs pa dang thabs cig tu gtsug lag khang rgyur 'gro bar spro ba des chos gos dag long zhig /
analyzed: khyed cag las gang de bzhin gshegs pa dang thabs cig tu gtsug lag khang rgyur 'gro bar spro ba des chos gos dag long zhig /
translated: Whoever among you wishes to go to the monastery with the Tathāgata should take their robes.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bdar te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bdar te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, surrounded by a group of monks and with the community of monks in front,

original: gtsug lag khang rgyu zhing gshegs pa na tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i gtsug lag khang ga la ba der gshegs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang rgyu zhing gshegs pa na tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i gtsug lag khang ga la ba der gshegs so //
translated: went to the monastery of the venerable Kāla.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i gtsug lag khang na 'bras chan skam po rab tu mang po dag bting zhing 'dug go /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i gtsug lag khang na 'bras chan skam po rab tu mang po dag bting zhing 'dug go /
translated: At that time, in the monastery of the venerable Kāla, a great deal of dry rice was spread out.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i gtsug lag khang na 'bras chan skam po rab tu mang po dag bting zhing 'dug pa gzigs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i gtsug lag khang na 'bras chan skam po rab tu mang po dag bting zhing 'dug pa gzigs so //
translated: The Blessed One saw that in the monastery of the venerable Kāla, a great deal of dry rice was spread out.

original: gzigs nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Having seen it, he said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo 'bras chan skam po rab tu mang po bting ba 'di dag su'i /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'bras chan skam po rab tu mang po bting ba 'di dag su'i /
translated: “Ānanda, whose is this great deal of dry rice spread out?”

original: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i kun tu spyod pa ni /
analyzed: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i kun tu spyod pa ni /
translated: “Venerable, the regular practice of the venerable Kāla is this:

original: grong ngam grong rdal gang na nye bar rten cing gnas pa na /
analyzed: grong ngam grong rdal gang na nye bar rten cing gnas pa na /
translated: Wherever he stays, whether in a village or town,

original: de snga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: de snga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: in the morning he puts on his lower robe,

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te grong ngam grong rdal de nyid du lus shin tu bsrungs pa dang @225a *//
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te grong ngam grong rdal de nyid du lus shin tu bsrungs pa dang @225a *//
translated: takes his bowl and robe, and with great physical care

original: dbang po rnams kyis shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag pas bsod snyoms la 'jug cing gal te 'bras chan gsher ba rnyed na ni lhung bzed kyis len par bgyid /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyis shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag pas bsod snyoms la 'jug cing gal te 'bras chan gsher ba rnyed na ni lhung bzed kyis len par bgyid /
translated: He is very restrained with his senses and, with his mindfulness well-established, he goes for alms. If he finds soft rice, he takes it in his alms bowl.

original: gal te 'bras chan skam po rnyed na ni lhung bzed kyi snod kyis len par bgyid de /
analyzed: gal te 'bras chan skam po rnyed na ni lhung bzed kyi snod kyis len par bgyid de /
translated: If he finds dry rice, he takes it in the bowl of his alms bowl.

original: de grong ngam grong rdal der bsod snyoms la brgyus nas /
analyzed: de grong ngam grong rdal der bsod snyoms la brgyus nas /
translated: After going for alms in that village or town,

original: gtsug lag khang du mchis te 'bras chan gsher ba ni 'tshal bar bgyid /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du mchis te 'bras chan gsher ba ni 'tshal bar bgyid /
translated: he returns to the monastery and eats the soft rice.

original: 'bras chan skam po ni bsams nas rdza ma so btang ba bkang ste 'jog par bgyid cing de bser ma ldang ba'am yul ngan byung ba'am dgung char 'bab pa'am dgung lhags 'byung ba gang dag byung bar gyur ba na /
analyzed: 'bras chan skam po ni bsams nas rdza ma so btang ba bkang ste 'jog par bgyid cing de bser ma ldang ba'am yul ngan byung ba'am dgung char 'bab pa'am dgung lhags 'byung ba gang dag byung bar gyur ba na /
translated: He stores the dry rice in a fired clay pot. When a wind arises, or when bad weather, rain, or snow falls,

original: bser ma langs pa'am yul ngan byung ba'am /
analyzed: bser ma langs pa'am yul ngan byung ba'am /
translated: the wind blows, or bad weather occurs,

original: dgung char 'bab pa'am dgung lhags byung ba de lta bu'i tshe 'bras chan skam po chab dron mos sbangs te 'tshal nas /
analyzed: dgung char 'bab pa'am dgung lhags byung ba de lta bu'i tshe 'bras chan skam po chab dron mos sbangs te 'tshal nas /
translated: When it rains or snows, or when it is cold, he eats hot porridge made with hot water.
